      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Deputies">
        Deputies
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=29" title="Edit section: Deputies">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <dl>
       <dd>
        <i>
         Main article:
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=2012_legislative_elections_in_Somme&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="2012 legislative elections in Somme (page does not exist)">
          2012 legislative elections in Somme
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89lections_l%C3%A9gislatives_de_2012_dans_la_Somme" title="fr:Élections législatives de 2012 dans la Somme">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
        </i>
       </dd>
      </dl>
      <p>
       Amiens is divided into two legislative districts:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=1st_district_of_the_Somme&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="1st district of the Somme (page does not exist)">
         1st district of the Somme
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premi%C3%A8re_circonscription_de_la_Somme" title="fr:Première circonscription de la Somme">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        (including Amiens II North-West, Amiens IV East, Amiens VIII North):
        <a href="/wiki/Pascal_Demarthe" title="Pascal Demarthe">
         Pascal Demarthe
        </a>
        (
        <a href="/wiki/Socialist_Party_(France)" title="Socialist Party (France)">
         PS
        </a>
        ) (he succeeded
        <a href="/wiki/Pascale_Boistard" title="Pascale Boistard">
         Pascale Boistard
        </a>
        , named Secretary of State for the rights of women of the
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Second_Valls_Government" title="Second Valls Government">
         Second Valls Government
        </a>
        on 26 August 2014)
       </li>
       <li>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=2nd_district_of_the_Somme&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="2nd district of the Somme (page does not exist)">
         2nd district of the Somme
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deuxi%C3%A8me_circonscription_de_la_Somme" title="fr:Deuxième circonscription de la Somme">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        (including Amiens I West, Amiens III North-East, Amiens V South-East, Amiens VII South-West, Amiens VI South):
        <a href="/wiki/Barbara_Pompili" title="Barbara Pompili">
         Barbara Pompili
        </a>
        (
        <a href="/wiki/Europe_Ecology_%E2%80%93_The_Greens" title="Europe Ecology – The Greens">
         EELV
        </a>
        )
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="List_of_mayors">
        List of mayors
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=30" title="Edit section: List of mayors">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main articles: [[:
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_mayors_of_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="List of mayors of Amiens (page does not exist)">
        List of mayors of Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liste_des_maires_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Liste des maires d'Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ]], [[:
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Municipal_elections_in_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Municipal elections in Amiens (page does not exist)">
        Municipal elections in Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89lections_municipales_%C3%A0_Amiens" title="fr:Élections municipales à Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ]], and [[:
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=2014_municipal_elections_in_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="2014 municipal elections in Amiens (page does not exist)">
        2014 municipal elections in Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89lection_municipale_de_2014_%C3%A0_Amiens" title="fr:Élection municipale de 2014 à Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ]]
      </div>
      <p>
       On 4 April 2014,
       <a href="/wiki/Brigitte_Four%C3%A9" title="Brigitte Fouré">
        Brigitte Fouré
       </a>
       (
       <a href="/wiki/Union_of_Democrats_and_Independents" title="Union of Democrats and Independents">
        IDU
       </a>
       <small>
        (
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_Centre" title="New Centre">
         NC
        </a>
        )
       </small>
       ) succeeded
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Gilles_Demailly&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Gilles Demailly (page does not exist)">
        Gilles Demailly
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilles_Demailly" title="fr:Gilles Demailly">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (
       <a href="/wiki/Socialist_Party_(France)" title="Socialist Party (France)">
        PS
       </a>
       ). Her list was elected in the second round on 30 March 2014 with 50.39% of the votes.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-34">
        <a href="#cite_note-34">
         [30]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>

         </td>

           Maurice Vast
          </a>
          <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
           (
           <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maurice_Vast" title="fr:Maurice Vast">
            fr
           </a>

         </td>
         <td>
          <a href="/wiki/French_Section_of_the_Workers%27_International" title="French Section of the Workers' International">
           SFIO
          </a>
         </td>
         <td>
          Industrialist, he ran the oils and fats business of "Igol". Mayor from 24 September 1944. Resigned on 27 May 1950. Councillor acting as Mayor until 7 June 1950.
         </td>

          </a>
          and
          <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Professeur_d%27enseignement_g%C3%A9n%C3%A9ral_de_coll%C3%A8ge&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Professeur d'enseignement général de collège (page does not exist)">
           Professor of general education of college
          </a>
          <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
           (
           <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Professeur_d%27enseignement_g%C3%A9n%C3%A9ral_de_coll%C3%A8ge" title="fr:Professeur d'enseignement général de collège">
            fr
           </a>
           )
          </span>
         </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
         <td>
          24 March 1989
         </td>
         <td>
          27 June 2002
         </td>
         <td>
          <a href="/wiki/Gilles_de_Robien" title="Gilles de Robien">
           Gilles de Robien
          </a>
         </td>
         <td>
          UDF-PR then
          <a href="/wiki/Union_for_French_Democracy" title="Union for French Democracy">
           UDF
          </a>
         </td>

          </a>
          and loan officer. Resigned in 2002 to join the Government.

          <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">

      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Judicial_and_administrative_authorities">
        Judicial and administrative authorities
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=31" title="Edit section: Judicial and administrative authorities">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       Amiens is a city marked by a strong judicial tradition, with the historical presence of its
       <a href="/wiki/Court_of_Appeal_(France)" title="Court of Appeal (France)">
        Court of Appeal
       </a>
       , the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Cour_d%27appel_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Cour d'appel d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
        Cour d'appel d'Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cour_d%27appel_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Cour d'appel d'Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , as well as all courts of first and second degree of
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Ordre_judiciaire_in_France&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Ordre judiciaire in France (page does not exist)">
        judicial order
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ordre_judiciaire_en_France" title="fr:Ordre judiciaire en France">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       . The Court of Appeal of Amiens has jurisdiction over the three departments of Picardy, with nine
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Tribunal_de_grande_instance_(France)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Tribunal de grande instance (France) (page does not exist)">
        high courts
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tribunal_de_grande_instance_(France)" title="fr:Tribunal de grande instance (France)">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       More recently, Amiens has become the seat of:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        The
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Cour_nationale_de_l%27incapacit%C3%A9_et_de_la_tarification_de_l%27assurance_des_accidents_du_travail&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Cour nationale de l'incapacité et de la tarification de l'assurance des accidents du travail (page does not exist)">
         national court of disability and the pricing of insurance for work accidents
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cour_nationale_de_l%27incapacit%C3%A9_et_de_la_tarification_de_l%27assurance_des_accidents_du_travail" title="fr:Cour nationale de l'incapacité et de la tarification de l'assurance des accidents du travail">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        .
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-35">
         <a href="#cite_note-35">
          [31]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        An
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Tribunal_administratif_(France)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Tribunal administratif (France) (page does not exist)">
         administrative tribunal
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tribunal_administratif_(France)" title="fr:Tribunal administratif (France)">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        whose rulings may be
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Appeal_in_French_justice&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Appeal in French justice (page does not exist)">
         appealed
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Appel_dans_la_justice_fran%C3%A7aise" title="fr:Appel dans la justice française">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        to the
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Cour_administrative_d%27appel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Cour administrative d'appel (page does not exist)">
         administrative court of appeal
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cour_administrative_d%27appel" title="fr:Cour administrative d'appel">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        of
        <a href="/wiki/Douai" title="Douai">
         Douai
        </a>
        .
       </li>
       <li>
        The
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Chambre_r%C3%A9gionale_des_comptes&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Chambre régionale des comptes (page does not exist)">
         Regional Chamber of Auditors
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chambre_r%C3%A9gionale_des_comptes" title="fr:Chambre régionale des comptes">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        of Picardy.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Environmental_policy">
        Environmental policy
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=32" title="Edit section: Environmental policy">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <table class="plainlinks metadata ambox mbox-small-left ambox-content" role="presentation">
       <tr>
        <td class="mbox-image">
         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg">
          <img alt="[icon]" data-file-height="31" data-file-width="44" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/20px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/30px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/40px-Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png 2x" width="20"/>
         </a>
        </td>
        <td class="mbox-text">
         <div class="mbox-text-span">
          <b>
           This section needs expansion
          </b>
          .
          <small>
           You can help by
           <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=">
            adding to it
           </a>
           .
          </small>
          <small>
           <i>
            (June 2015)
           </i>
          </small>
         </div>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <h3>
       <span id="Twin_towns_.E2.80.93_sister_cities">
       </span>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Twin_towns_–_sister_cities">
        Twin towns – sister cities
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=33" title="Edit section: Twin towns – sister cities">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       See also:
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_twin_towns_and_sister_cities_in_France" title="List of twin towns and sister cities in France">
        List of twin towns and sister cities in France
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       According to the official database of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs dated 11 November 2013, Amiens is
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Twin_towns_and_sister_cities" title="Twin towns and sister cities">
        twinned
       </a>
       with four municipalities, with Nafplio not listed:
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-JUMEL_36-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-JUMEL-36">
         [32]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Germany" title="Germany">
          <img alt="Germany" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1000" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/23px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/35px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/46px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Dortmund" title="Dortmund">
         Dortmund
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/North_Rhine-Westphalia" title="North Rhine-Westphalia">
         North Rhine-Westphalia
        </a>
        , Germany
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-RuhrTwins2010_37-0">
         <a href="#cite_note-RuhrTwins2010-37">
          [33]
         </a>
        </sup>
        since 1960. It was the first Franco-German pairing formalised in France.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-38">
         <a href="#cite_note-38">
          [34]
         </a>
        </sup>
        Exchanges are artistic and cultural.
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Germany" title="Germany">
          <img alt="Germany" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1000" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/23px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/35px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/46px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/G%C3%B6rlitz" title="Görlitz">
         Görlitz
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Saxony" title="Saxony">
         Saxony
        </a>
        , Germany
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-RuhrTwins2010_37-1">
         <a href="#cite_note-RuhrTwins2010-37">
          [33]
         </a>
        </sup>
        since 1971.
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">
          <img alt="England" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="480" data-file-width="800" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/23px-Flag_of_England.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/35px-Flag_of_England.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/46px-Flag_of_England.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Darlington" title="Darlington">
         Darlington
        </a>
        , England,
        <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom">
         United Kingdom
        </a>
        ,
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Archant_twinning_3_39-0">
         <a href="#cite_note-Archant_twinning_3-39">
          [35]
         </a>
        </sup>
        since 1973.
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Norway" title="Norway">
          <img alt="Norway" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="800" data-file-width="1100" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Flag_of_Norway.svg/21px-Flag_of_Norway.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Flag_of_Norway.svg/32px-Flag_of_Norway.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Flag_of_Norway.svg/41px-Flag_of_Norway.svg.png 2x" width="21"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Bergen" title="Bergen">
         Bergen
        </a>
        , Norway, since 2005.
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">
          <img alt="Greece" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="400" data-file-width="600" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Greece.svg/23px-Flag_of_Greece.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Greece.svg/35px-Flag_of_Greece.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Greece.svg/45px-Flag_of_Greece.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Nafplio" title="Nafplio">
         Nafplio
        </a>
        , Greece
        <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
         [
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
           <span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2015)">
            citation needed
           </span>
          </a>
         </i>
         ]
        </sup>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Furthermore, the municipality has signed contracts of cultural and economic partnerships with several communes:
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-JUMEL_36-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-JUMEL-36">
         [32]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Belgium" title="Belgium">
          <img alt="Belgium" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="450" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg/45px-Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Brussels" title="Brussels">
         Brussels
        </a>
        , Belgium
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Cameroon" title="Cameroon">
          <img alt="Cameroon" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="400" data-file-width="600" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/Flag_of_Cameroon.svg/23px-Flag_of_Cameroon.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/Flag_of_Cameroon.svg/35px-Flag_of_Cameroon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4f/Flag_of_Cameroon.svg/45px-Flag_of_Cameroon.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=M%27bam&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="M'bam (page does not exist)">
         M'bam
        </a>
        , Cameroon
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">
          <img alt="Italy" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="1000" data-file-width="1500" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/23px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/35px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/45px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Rome" title="Rome">
         Rome
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Lazio" title="Lazio">
         Lazio
        </a>
        , Italy
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">
          <img alt="Romania" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="400" data-file-width="600" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Flag_of_Romania.svg/23px-Flag_of_Romania.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Flag_of_Romania.svg/35px-Flag_of_Romania.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Flag_of_Romania.svg/45px-Flag_of_Romania.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Baia_Mare" title="Baia Mare">
         Baia Mare
        </a>
        , Romania, since 2000.
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">
          <img alt="England" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="480" data-file-width="800" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/23px-Flag_of_England.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/35px-Flag_of_England.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/46px-Flag_of_England.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Howden-le-Wear" title="Howden-le-Wear">
         Howden-le-Wear
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Durham,_England" title="Durham, England">
         Durham
        </a>
        , England, United Kingdom
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Finally, Amiens participates in partnerships signed by the agglomeration community:
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-JUMEL_36-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-JUMEL-36">
         [32]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Cape_Verde" title="Cape Verde">
          <img alt="Cape Verde" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="510" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Flag_of_Cape_Verde.svg/23px-Flag_of_Cape_Verde.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Flag_of_Cape_Verde.svg/35px-Flag_of_Cape_Verde.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Flag_of_Cape_Verde.svg/46px-Flag_of_Cape_Verde.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Santa_Catarina,_Cape_Verde" title="Santa Catarina, Cape Verde">
         Santa Catarina
        </a>
        , Cape Verde. The cities include partners in the field of water and sanitation.
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/Ukraine" title="Ukraine">
          <img alt="Ukraine" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="800" data-file-width="1200" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Ukraine.svg/23px-Flag_of_Ukraine.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Ukraine.svg/35px-Flag_of_Ukraine.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Ukraine.svg/45px-Flag_of_Ukraine.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Lviv" title="Lviv">
         Lviv
        </a>
        , Ukraine: Draft exchange of apprentices and teachers in the catering industry.
       </li>
       <li>
        <span class="flagicon">
         <a href="/wiki/England" title="England">
          <img alt="England" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="480" data-file-width="800" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/23px-Flag_of_England.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/35px-Flag_of_England.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/be/Flag_of_England.svg/46px-Flag_of_England.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>
         </a>
        </span>
        <a href="/wiki/Brighton_and_Hove" title="Brighton and Hove">
         Brighton and Hove
        </a>
        , England, United Kingdom, since 2006. Cities shall cooperate in particular through the
        <i>
         Nuit blanche
        </i>
        and the European project "Beyond the blue - Woad".
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       It should be noted that on the same date, the site of the Communauté d'agglomération does cite only three twinnings with Dortmund, Görlitz and Darlington and does not cite the twinning with Bergen. Similarly, it cited the contract of partnership with Lviv, but none of the other partnerships, and adds a partnership with
       <a href="/wiki/Tulsa,_Oklahoma" title="Tulsa, Oklahoma">
        Tulsa
       </a>
       in the United States.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-40">
        <a href="#cite_note-40">
         [36]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Furthermore, in 1997, a cooperation agreement and a twinning charter signed between Amiens and the Chinese city of
       <a href="/wiki/Mianyang" title="Mianyang">
        Mianyang
       </a>
       . These were renewed in 2014 with aims to bring the two cities closer on various levels: economic, cultural, scientific, etc.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-41">
        <a href="#cite_note-41">
         [37]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Population_and_society">
        Population and society
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=34" title="Edit section: Population and society">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Demography">
        Demography
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=35" title="Edit section: Demography">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       The inhabitants of Amiens are called the
       <i>
        Amiénois
       </i>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-42">
        <a href="#cite_note-42">
         [38]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and their
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Nom_jet%C3%A9&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Nom jeté (page does not exist)">
        nom jeté
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/nom_jet%C3%A9" title="fr:nom jeté">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       is
       <i>
        Chés maqueux d'gueugues
       </i>
       (the eaters of nuts).
      </p>
      <p>
       The population of Amiens has risen sharply since the mid-19th century: Its population doubled between 1850 and 1960, from 50,000 to 100,000 inhabitants, i.e. a gain of 50,000 people over this period of 110 years, and gaining about 30,000 others since (over 50 years only this time).
      </p>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Demographic_evolution">
        Demographic evolution
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=36" title="Edit section: Demographic evolution">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <p>
       In 2012, the commune had 132,727 inhabitants. The evolution of the number of inhabitants is known through the population censuses carried out in the town since 1793. From the 21st century, the communes with more than 10,000 inhabitants census takes place every year as a result of a sample survey, unlike the other communes which have a real census every five years.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-43">
        <a href="#cite_note-43">
         [note 2]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-44">
        <a href="#cite_note-44">
         [note 3]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <table class="toccolours" style="width:60em;border-spacing: 0;margin:0.5em auto;">

      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Age_structure">
        Age structure
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=37" title="Edit section: Age structure">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <p>
       Amiens is distinguished by the youthfulness of its population. Indeed, in 2012, more than 25% of the population of the city was less than 20 years old. The rate of people of an age over 60 years (16.9%) is also lower than the national rate (21.6%) and the departmental rate (21%). Like national and departmental allocations, the female population of the municipality is greater in number to the male population, with a rate of 52.9 percent, whereas the national rate is 51.6%. In 2007, the distribution of the population of the town by age group was as follows:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        47.1% of men (0–14 years = 19.3%, 15–29 years = 30%, 30–44 years = 20.4%, 45–59 years = 16.3%, more than 60 years = 14%)
       </li>
       <li>
        52.9% of women (0–14 years = 16%, 15–29 years = 28.4% 30-44 year olds = 18.6%, 45–59 years = 17.4%, more than 60 years = 19.5%)
       </li>
      </ul>
      <table style="margin:auto; width:100%;">
       <tr>
        <td style="width:50%;">
         <table align="none" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="8" class="plainlinks">
          <tr>
           <td align="center" colspan="2">
            <b>
             Population by age of Somme, 2009 (%)
            </b>
           </td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
           <td>
            <table cellspacing="8" style="text-align:center;border-collapse:collapse;">
             <tr>
              <td style="text-align:center;">
               <table cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0">

                     <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;float:left;" title="18.2/2">
                      <tr>
                       <td>
                        <div align="center">
                        </div>
                        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
                         <tr>

            <p>
             Total: 100.05
            </p>
            <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;text-align:center;" title="50">
             <tr>

                <tr>
                 <td>
                  <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-top:1px solid #888;border-bottom:1px solid #888;border-left:1px solid #888;border-right:1px solid #888;background:blue;">

                    </td>

                  <small>
                   male
                  </small>
                 </td>
                </tr>

             <tr>
