      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Education">
        Education
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=38" title="Edit section: Education">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Primary_and_secondary_education">
        Primary and secondary education
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=39" title="Edit section: Primary and secondary education">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <p>
       Educational institutions of the city fall under the supervision of the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Acad%C3%A9mie_d%27Amiens_(%C3%A9ducation)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Académie d'Amiens (éducation) (page does not exist)">
        Academy of Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acad%C3%A9mie_d%27Amiens_(%C3%A9ducation)" title="fr:Académie d'Amiens (éducation)">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-49">
        <a href="#cite_note-49">
         [42]
        </a>
       </sup>
       which develops according to the
       <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Education_(France)" title="Ministry of National Education (France)">
        Inspection académique la Somme
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       On 1 September 2010, 10,658 children were enrolled in the Amiens public schools: 4,341 in
       <a href="/wiki/Kindergarten" title="Kindergarten">
        nursery school
       </a>
       and 6,317 in
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Elementary_schools_in_France&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Elementary schools in France (page does not exist)">
        elementary school
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89cole_%C3%A9l%C3%A9mentaire_en_France" title="fr:École élémentaire en France">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-50">
        <a href="#cite_note-50">
         [43]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       In 2011, the Amiens agglomeration included 46 nursery schools, six elementary schools and 54 primary schools including eleven private. It had nine public colleges and six private colleges. Amiens has 24 schools:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Vocational high schools: Acheuléen, Édouard-Branly, Edouard-Gand,
        <a href="/wiki/Lyc%C3%A9e_la_Providence" title="Lycée la Providence">
         La Providence
        </a>
        (private), Montaigne, Romain Rolland,
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Lyc%C3%A9e_Sacr%C3%A9-C%C5%93ur_(Amiens)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Lycée Sacré-Cœur (Amiens) (page does not exist)">
         Sacré-Cœur
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyc%C3%A9e_Sacr%C3%A9-C%C5%93ur_(Amiens)" title="fr:Lycée Sacré-Cœur (Amiens)">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        (private), Saint-Martin (private), Saint-Rémi (private) and Saint-Riquier (private).
       </li>
       <li>
        General and technological high schools: Robert de Luzarches, La Hotoie, Jean Baptiste Delambre, La Providence (private),
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Lyc%C3%A9e_Sacr%C3%A9-C%C5%93ur_(Amiens)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Lycée Sacré-Cœur (Amiens) (page does not exist)">
         Sacré-Cœur
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyc%C3%A9e_Sacr%C3%A9-C%C5%93ur_(Amiens)" title="fr:Lycée Sacré-Cœur (Amiens)">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        (private), Saint-Martin (private), Saint-Rémi (private), Saint-Riquier (private) and Sainte-Famille (private).
       </li>
       <li>
        General secondary schools:
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Lyc%C3%A9e_Louis-Thuillier&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Lycée Louis-Thuillier (page does not exist)">
         Louis Thuillier
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyc%C3%A9e_Louis-Thuillier" title="fr:Lycée Louis-Thuillier">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        , Madeleine Michelis (former high school for girls, established in 1883 by Marie Hugonin, wife of
        <a href="/wiki/Charles_Eug%C3%A8ne_Bertrand" title="Charles Eugène Bertrand">
         Charles Eugène Bertrand
        </a>
        , mother of
        <a href="/wiki/Paul_Bertrand" title="Paul Bertrand">
         Paul Bertrand
        </a>
        and niece of Bishop
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Flavien-Abel-Antoine_Hugonin&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Flavien-Abel-Antoine Hugonin (page does not exist)">
         Flavien-Abel-Antoine Hugonin
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flavien-Abel-Antoine_Hugonin" title="fr:Flavien-Abel-Antoine Hugonin">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        , Bishop of
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bishopric_of_Bayeux" title="Bishopric of Bayeux">
         Bayeux
        </a>
        and
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bishopric_of_Lisieux" title="Bishopric of Lisieux">
         Lisieux
        </a>
        - the inaugural speech was delivered by
        <a href="/wiki/Jules_Verne" title="Jules Verne">
         Jules Verne
        </a>
        .)
       </li>
       <li>
        Technological lycées: Édouard-Branly, Edouard-Gand.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Higher_education">
        Higher education
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=40" title="Edit section: Higher education">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <p>
       The Amiens metropole welcomes one of the largest student populations in France. In 2013, the city has 26,000 students (3,300 in short-term)
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-51">
        <a href="#cite_note-51">
         [44]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and 800 researchers
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-52">
        <a href="#cite_note-52">
         [45]
        </a>
       </sup>
       who are divided into some 40 institutions of higher education, 32 laboratories, 10 units associated with the
       <a href="/wiki/Centre_national_de_la_recherche_scientifique" title="Centre national de la recherche scientifique">
        National scientific Research Centre
       </a>
       or the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/French_Institute_of_Health_and_Medical_Research" title="French Institute of Health and Medical Research">
        French Institute of Health and Medical Research
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <div class="div-col columns column-width" style="-moz-column-width: 30em; -webkit-column-width: 30em; column-width: 30em;">
       <ul>
        <li>
         The
         <a href="/wiki/University_of_Picardie_Jules_Verne" title="University of Picardie Jules Verne">
          University of Picardie Jules Verne
         </a>
         (UPJV) headquartered in Amiens and has a broad range of courses:
         <ul>
          <li>
           Faculty of Medicine and Pharmacy
          </li>
          <li>
           Faculty of Law, Politics and Economics
          </li>
          <li>
           Faculty of Sciences
          </li>
          <li>
           <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Institut_universitaire_professionnalis%C3%A9&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Institut universitaire professionnalisé (page does not exist)">
            IUP
           </a>
           MIAGE (computing in companies)
          </li>
          <li>
           Faculty of
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Human_Sciences" title="Human Sciences">
            Human Sciences
           </a>
           , Literature, Languages, Sport Sciences
          </li>
          <li>
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Institut_universitaire_de_technologie" title="Institut universitaire de technologie">
            IUT
           </a>
           (Institut Universitaire Technique) of Management, Administration, Computing, Mechanical Engineering, Biological Engineering, Commercial Management.
          </li>
          <li>
           Faculty of Arts
          </li>
         </ul>
        </li>
        <li>
         Preparatory courses for sciences, economics, biology schools and others
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/ESIEE" title="ESIEE">
          ESIEE
         </a>
         (Engineering School of Electronics and Electrical Technology)
        </li>
        <li>
         Business school
        </li>
        <li>
         <a class="external text" href="http://www.esc-amiens.com/international/" rel="nofollow">
          ESC Amiens (Business school)
         </a>
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/ESAD" title="ESAD">
          ESAD
         </a>
         (School of Art and Design)
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/Brevet_de_technicien_sup%C3%A9rieur" title="Brevet de technicien supérieur">
          Brevet de technicien supérieur
         </a>
         (advanced vocational diploma) in audio-visual methods
        </li>
        <li>
         School of
         <a href="/wiki/Nursing" title="Nursing">
          Nursing
         </a>
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/Midwifery" title="Midwifery">
          Midwifery
         </a>
         college
        </li>
        <li>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Physiotherapy" title="Physiotherapy">
          Physiotherapy
         </a>
         and Massage School
        </li>
        <li>
         Teacher training college
        </li>
       </ul>
      </div>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Health">
        Health
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=41" title="Edit section: Health">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       The
       <abbr title="Centre hospitalier universitaire (Teaching hospital)">
        CHU
       </abbr>
       (Centre Hospitalier Universitaire) of Amiens Picardie is organized around four sites:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        South Hospital,
        <i>
         Avenue René-Laënnec
        </i>
       </li>
       <li>
        North Hospital,
        <i>
         Place Victor-Pauchet
        </i>
       </li>
       <li>
        Saint-Victor Centre, 354
        <i>
         Bis Boulevard de Beauville
        </i>
       </li>
       <li>
        Obstetrics and Gynaecology Centre, 124
        <i>
         Rue Camille-Desmoulins
        </i>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       From 2014, the four sites were gradually gathered on the current site of the South Hospital, with the exception of the long stay units for the elderly remaining in the Saint-Victor Centre. This merger will be completed in 2016 and allow the CHU of Amiens to increase its national and inter-regional dimension. This group represents the largest hospital construction of France and one of the most important in Europe (more than €630 million of work and equipment). At the end of the work, the total space of the CHU of Amiens will be 172,000 square metres (1,850,000 sq ft). It will count three blocks of hospitalisation with 400 beds each. The CHU of Amiens is the largest employer in the
       <a href="/wiki/Picardy" title="Picardy">
        Picardy
       </a>
       region. At the end of the merger, there will be 6,700 employees, 1,300 students of the professions of health and 1,250 consultants who will go there each day.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-53">
        <a href="#cite_note-53">
         [46]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       In order to maintain a supply of health to the north of the city, a health centre will open its doors in the first quarter of 2016, at the crossroads of the
       <i>
        Avenue de l'Europe
       </i>
       and the
       <i>
        Rue Maurice-Ravel
       </i>
       . This health space of 1,200 square metres (13,000 sq ft) will host general practitioners and specialists of the CHU (cardiologist, a service of gynaecology-obstetrics, psychologists, dentist, masseurs-physiotherapists, etc.) with the promise of a
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Permanence_of_care&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Permanence of care (page does not exist)">
        permanence of care
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permanence_des_soins" title="fr:Permanence des soins">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (7 days a week and 24 hours a day).
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-54">
        <a href="#cite_note-54">
         [47]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Alongside the CHU, there are three private clinics, resulting from the consolidation of old clinics in the city. These care and hospitalisation institutions for medical, surgical, and obstetrics came together to create a private hospital centre in the Vallée des Vignes quarter, south of the city.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Polyclinic of Picardy, 43
        <i>
         Rue Alexandre Dumas
        </i>
       </li>
       <li>
        Clinic of Europe, 5
        <i>
         Allée des Pays-Bas
        </i>
       </li>
       <li>
        Victor Pauchet Heath Group, 2
        <i>
         Avenue Irlande
        </i>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The CHU of Amiens figured in 11th place in the
       <i>
        2013 awards of the hospitals and clinics
       </i>
       of the magazine
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Le_Point" title="Le Point">
         Le Point
        </a>
       </i>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-55">
        <a href="#cite_note-55">
         [48]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In this ranking, the CHU stands out for ankle surgery (3rd), hip prosthesis (5th), foot surgery (7th) and paediatrics (14th). In this same classification, the Victor Palmer Health Group, equipped with a solid "mother-to-child hub", gained a 5th place in the table for the gynaecological clinics and an 8th place for breast cancers.
      </p>
      <p>
       In 2005, the CHU of Amiens became of international renown thanks to Professor
       <a href="/wiki/Bernard_Devauchelle" title="Bernard Devauchelle">
        Bernard Devauchelle
       </a>
       , a native of the city, where his team performed the first partial
       <a href="/wiki/Face_transplant" title="Face transplant">
        face transplant
       </a>
       in the world.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-56">
        <a href="#cite_note-56">
         [49]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Sport">
        Sport
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=42" title="Edit section: Sport">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article: [[:
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Sport_in_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Sport in Amiens (page does not exist)">
        Sport in Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sport_%C3%A0_Amiens" title="fr:Sport à Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ]]
      </div>
      <p>
       Thanks to the youth of its population, the dynamism and the success of its sports clubs, Amiens has been awarded the title of
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=The_sportiest_city_of_France&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="The sportiest city of France (page does not exist)">
        "Sportiest city of France"
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Challenge_de_la_ville_la_plus_sportive_de_France" title="fr:Challenge de la ville la plus sportive de France">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       by the
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/L%27Equipe" title="L'Equipe">
         L'Equipe
        </a>
       </i>
       newspaper in 1999. She had already won the title in 1969. In 2013, Amiens Métropole has nearly 300 sports associations and Sports Recreation: approximately 150 associations are grouped within the Office of Amiens Metropole Sports
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-57">
        <a href="#cite_note-57">
         [50]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and 150 others are referenced without being adherents.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-58">
        <a href="#cite_note-58">
         [51]
        </a>
       </sup>
       According to this same Office for Sports, Amiens has 25,000 members of sports clubs (excluding school and university members).
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:American_football_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="American football pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9c/American_football_pictogram.svg/25px-American_football_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9c/American_football_pictogram.svg/38px-American_football_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9c/American_football_pictogram.svg/50px-American_football_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/American_Football" title="American Football">
         American Football
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Amiens_Spartiates" title="Amiens Spartiates">
        Amiens Spartiates
       </a>
       , operating in the
       <a href="/wiki/Ligue_%C3%89lite_de_Football_Am%C3%A9ricain" title="Ligue Élite de Football Américain">
        Casque de diamant
       </a>
       (D1), champions of France in 2004, 2010 and 2012. Created in 1987, the club has more than 400 licensees.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Athletics_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Athletics pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8f/Athletics_pictogram.svg/25px-Athletics_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8f/Athletics_pictogram.svg/38px-Athletics_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8f/Athletics_pictogram.svg/50px-Athletics_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Athletics_(sport)" title="Athletics (sport)">
         Athletics
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_Universit%C3%A9_Club_Athl%C3%A9tisme&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens Université Club Athlétisme (page does not exist)">
        AUC Athlétisme
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiens_Universit%C3%A9_Club_Athl%C3%A9tisme" title="fr:Amiens Université Club Athlétisme">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       is a multidisciplinary athletic club which particularly developed
       <a href="/wiki/Stella_Akakpo" title="Stella Akakpo">
        Stella Akakpo
       </a>
       , specialist of the
       <a href="/wiki/Sprint_(running)" title="Sprint (running)">
        sprint
       </a>
       and the relay.
       <a href="/wiki/Bertrand_Moulinet" title="Bertrand Moulinet">
        Bertrand Moulinet
       </a>
       specialist of the
       <a href="/wiki/20_kilometres_race_walk" title="20 kilometres race walk">
        20 km
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/50_kilometres_race_walk" title="50 kilometres race walk">
        50 km walk
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Badminton_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Badminton pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Badminton_pictogram.svg/25px-Badminton_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Badminton_pictogram.svg/38px-Badminton_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/90/Badminton_pictogram.svg/50px-Badminton_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Badminton" title="Badminton">
         Badminton
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The AUC Badminton (Amiens University Badminton Club) was founded in 1986. Labeled "French school of badminton" by the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=F%C3%A9d%C3%A9ration_fran%C3%A7aise_de_badminton&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Fédération française de badminton (page does not exist)">
        French Federation of badminton
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/F%C3%A9d%C3%A9ration_fran%C3%A7aise_de_badminton" title="fr:Fédération française de badminton">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , the club had 205 members in 2014.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-59">
        <a href="#cite_note-59">
         [52]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The city hosted the
       <a href="/wiki/French_National_Badminton_Championships" title="French National Badminton Championships">
        French National Badminton Championships
       </a>
       in 2011.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Fencing_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Fencing pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/Fencing_pictogram.svg/25px-Fencing_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/Fencing_pictogram.svg/38px-Fencing_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/Fencing_pictogram.svg/50px-Fencing_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Fencing" title="Fencing">
         Fencing
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The Circle of Fencing of Amiens Métropole is one of the oldest French clubs. It was succeeded in the Hall of arms of Amiens opened in 1886. The circle has approximately 150 members and remains a major club of French fencing with many qualifications and results at the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Championnats_de_France_d%27escrime&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Championnats de France d'escrime (page does not exist)">
        Championships of France of fencing
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnats_de_France_d%27escrime" title="fr:Championnats de France d'escrime">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       . The club held the Elite French Championships in 2001 and 2011.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Field_hockey_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Field hockey pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/Field_hockey_pictogram.svg/25px-Field_hockey_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/Field_hockey_pictogram.svg/38px-Field_hockey_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/Field_hockey_pictogram.svg/50px-Field_hockey_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Field_hockey" title="Field hockey">
         Hockey
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_Sports_Club_(field_hockey)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens Sports Club (field hockey) (page does not exist)">
        Amiens Sports Club
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiens_Sports_Club_(hockey_sur_gazon)" title="fr:Amiens Sports Club (hockey sur gazon)">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , currently playing in
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Championnat_de_France_de_hockey_sur_gazon&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Championnat de France de hockey sur gazon (page does not exist)">
        League Elite
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnat_de_France_de_hockey_sur_gazon" title="fr:Championnat de France de hockey sur gazon">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       D1), champions of France men in 1981, 1982, 1986, 1987, 1988, 1989 and champions France women in 1983, 1984, 1993, 1995.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Indoor_hockey_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Indoor hockey pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Indoor_hockey_pictogram.svg/25px-Indoor_hockey_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Indoor_hockey_pictogram.svg/38px-Indoor_hockey_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Indoor_hockey_pictogram.svg/50px-Indoor_hockey_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Floorball" title="Floorball">
         Floorball
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Association_ami%C3%A9noise_de_floorball&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Association amiénoise de floorball (page does not exist)">
        Hoplites d'Ambiani
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_ami%C3%A9noise_de_floorball" title="fr:Association amiénoise de floorball">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ,
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Championnat_de_France_de_floorball_D1&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Championnat de France de floorball D1 (page does not exist)">
        D1
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnat_de_France_de_floorball_D1" title="fr:Championnat de France de floorball D1">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       . A second team is evolving in
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Championnat_de_France_de_floorball_D2&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Championnat de France de floorball D2 (page does not exist)">
        D2
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnat_de_France_de_floorball_D2" title="fr:Championnat de France de floorball D2">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Football_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Football pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Football_pictogram.svg/25px-Football_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Football_pictogram.svg/38px-Football_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Football_pictogram.svg/50px-Football_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Football" title="Football">
         Football
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Amiens_SC" title="Amiens SC">
        Amiens SC
       </a>
       , for
       <a href="/wiki/Championnat_National" title="Championnat National">
        National
       </a>
       (D3). The team was a finalist of the
       <a href="/wiki/Coupe_de_France" title="Coupe de France">
        Coupe de France
       </a>
       in 2001 and semi-finalists in 1930 and 2008. CSA Club, Amiens SC women's team plays in
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Championnat_de_France_de_football_f%C3%A9minin_D2" title="Championnat de France de football féminin D2">
        Division 2
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnat_de_France_de_football_f%C3%A9minin_D2" title="fr:Championnat de France de football féminin D2">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       . Before the 2012-2013 season, the team was known under the name of CS Amiens Montieres Etouvie. The
       <a href="/wiki/Amiens_AC" title="Amiens AC">
        Amiens AC
       </a>
       , currently playing in the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Championnat_de_France_Amateur" title="Championnat de France Amateur">
        CFA
       </a>
       (D4).
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Golf_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Golf pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5f/Golf_pictogram.svg/25px-Golf_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5f/Golf_pictogram.svg/38px-Golf_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5f/Golf_pictogram.svg/50px-Golf_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Golf" title="Golf">
         Golf
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The Golf Club D'amiens was founded in 1924. The men's team plays in
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Troph%C3%A9e_Gounouilhou&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Trophée Gounouilhou (page does not exist)">
        D1
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Troph%C3%A9e_Gounouilhou" title="fr:Trophée Gounouilhou">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , women team in D2. The club has 530 members in 2013.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-60">
        <a href="#cite_note-60">
         [53]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Handball_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Handball pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Handball_pictogram.svg/25px-Handball_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Handball_pictogram.svg/38px-Handball_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Handball_pictogram.svg/50px-Handball_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Handball" title="Handball">
         Handball
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_Picardie_Hand&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens Picardie Hand (page does not exist)">
        Amiens Picardie Hand
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiens_Picardie_Hand" title="fr:Amiens Picardie Hand">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (APH), currently playing in
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Championnat_de_France_de_handball_masculin_de_Nationale_2&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Championnat de France de handball masculin de Nationale 2 (page does not exist)">
        National 2
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnat_de_France_de_handball_masculin_de_Nationale_2" title="fr:Championnat de France de handball masculin de Nationale 2">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (D4). The club, result of the merger of several clubs Amiens, was created in 1991.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Ice_hockey_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Ice hockey pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/Ice_hockey_pictogram.svg/25px-Ice_hockey_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/Ice_hockey_pictogram.svg/38px-Ice_hockey_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/Ice_hockey_pictogram.svg/50px-Ice_hockey_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Ice_hockey" title="Ice hockey">
         Ice hockey
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Gothiques_d%27Amiens" title="Gothiques d'Amiens">
        Gothiques d'Amiens
       </a>
       , currently playing in
       <a href="/wiki/Ligue_Magnus" title="Ligue Magnus">
        Ligue Magnus
       </a>
       (D1), champions of France in 1999 and 2004 runners-up France in 1989, 1997, 1998, 2003 and 2006. The team plays at the
       <a href="/wiki/Colis%C3%A9um" title="Coliséum">
        Coliséum
       </a>
       on the largest area of permanent ice of France (3800 seats). Amiens hosted the Division I of the
       <a href="/wiki/2006_Men%27s_World_Ice_Hockey_Championships" title="2006 Men's World Ice Hockey Championships">
        2006
       </a>
       <a href="/wiki/Ice_Hockey_World_Championships" title="Ice Hockey World Championships">
        Ice Hockey World Championships
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Tennis_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Tennis pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Tennis_pictogram.svg/25px-Tennis_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Tennis_pictogram.svg/38px-Tennis_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Tennis_pictogram.svg/50px-Tennis_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Longue_paume" title="Longue paume">
         Longue paume
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Amiens won 10 times the Championship of France in 6/6.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Valencian_pelota_pictogram.jpg">
         <img alt="Valencian pelota pictogram.jpg" data-file-height="2000" data-file-width="2000" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Valencian_pelota_pictogram.jpg/25px-Valencian_pelota_pictogram.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Valencian_pelota_pictogram.jpg/38px-Valencian_pelota_pictogram.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Valencian_pelota_pictogram.jpg/50px-Valencian_pelota_pictogram.jpg 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Ballon_au_poing" title="Ballon au poing">
         Ballon au poing
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Each 15 August at the Parc de la Hotoie, Amiens receives the final stages of
       <a href="/wiki/Ballon_au_poing" title="Ballon au poing">
        Ballon au poing
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Inline_hockey_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Inline hockey pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/Inline_hockey_pictogram.svg/25px-Inline_hockey_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/Inline_hockey_pictogram.svg/38px-Inline_hockey_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/Inline_hockey_pictogram.svg/50px-Inline_hockey_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Roller_in-line_hockey" title="Roller in-line hockey">
         Roller in-line hockey
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Roller_Skating_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Roller Skating Amiens (page does not exist)">
        Écureuils d'Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roller_Skating_Amiens" title="fr:Roller Skating Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ,
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Championnat_de_France_de_roller_in_line_hockey&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Championnat de France de roller in line hockey (page does not exist)">
        Elite League
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnat_de_France_de_roller_in_line_hockey" title="fr:Championnat de France de roller in line hockey">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (D1), runners-up France in 2010, finalists of the Coupe de France in 2007 and finalists of the European Cup of clubs in 2008.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-61">
        <a href="#cite_note-61">
         [54]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Rowing_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Rowing pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/57/Rowing_pictogram.svg/25px-Rowing_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/57/Rowing_pictogram.svg/38px-Rowing_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/57/Rowing_pictogram.svg/50px-Rowing_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Rowing_(sport)" title="Rowing (sport)">
         Rowing
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The Sport Nautique d'Amiens (SNA) was founded in 1866. Located on the edge of the Parc Saint-Pierre, it is labeled "French rowing school 3 stars" by the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=F%C3%A9d%C3%A9ration_fran%C3%A7aise_d%27aviron&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Fédération française d'aviron (page does not exist)">
        French Federation of rowing
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/F%C3%A9d%C3%A9ration_fran%C3%A7aise_d%27aviron" title="fr:Fédération française d'aviron">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       . With 465 members in 2013,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-62">
        <a href="#cite_note-62">
         [55]
        </a>
       </sup>
       the club currently competes in the 2nd division.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Rugby_union_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Rugby union pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f4/Rugby_union_pictogram.svg/25px-Rugby_union_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f4/Rugby_union_pictogram.svg/38px-Rugby_union_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f4/Rugby_union_pictogram.svg/50px-Rugby_union_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Rugby_union" title="Rugby union">
         Rugby union
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The Rugby Club Amiénois (RCA) was founded in 1900. The men's first team plays in
       <a href="/wiki/F%C3%A9d%C3%A9rale_3" title="Fédérale 3">
        Fédérale 3
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Swimming_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Swimming pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/Swimming_pictogram.svg/25px-Swimming_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/Swimming_pictogram.svg/38px-Swimming_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/Swimming_pictogram.svg/50px-Swimming_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Swimming_(sport)" title="Swimming (sport)">
         Swimming
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_M%C3%A9tropole_Natation&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens Métropole Natation (page does not exist)">
        Amiens Métropole
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiens_M%C3%A9tropole_Natation" title="fr:Amiens Métropole Natation">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       swimming, club of
       <a href="/wiki/J%C3%A9r%C3%A9my_Stravius" title="Jérémy Stravius">
        Jérémy Stravius
       </a>
       , triple world champion of swimming and Olympic champion in the 4 × 100 m relay. The club hosted the French Youth Championships in 2012 at the
       <a href="/wiki/Colis%C3%A9um" title="Coliséum">
        Coliséum
       </a>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Table_tennis_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Table tennis pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Table_tennis_pictogram.svg/25px-Table_tennis_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Table_tennis_pictogram.svg/38px-Table_tennis_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Table_tennis_pictogram.svg/50px-Table_tennis_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Table_tennis" title="Table tennis">
         Table tennis
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_Sport_Tennis_de_table&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens Sport Tennis de table (page does not exist)">
        Amiens Sport Table Tennis
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiens_Sport_Tennis_de_table" title="fr:Amiens Sport Tennis de table">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (ASTT) was founded in 1945. It was twice crowned champion of France in 1968 and 1969. The men's first team also won the Coupe de France in 1966 and 1967.
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Tennis_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Tennis pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Tennis_pictogram.svg/25px-Tennis_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Tennis_pictogram.svg/38px-Tennis_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Tennis_pictogram.svg/50px-Tennis_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Tennis" title="Tennis">
         Tennis
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Amiens Athletic Club (AAC) was founded in 1904. It is one of the 10 biggest clubs in France with almost 1,000 members in 2013.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-63">
        <a href="#cite_note-63">
         [56]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Volleyball_(indoor)_pictogram.svg">
         <img alt="Volleyball (indoor) pictogram.svg" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="25" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Volleyball_%28indoor%29_pictogram.svg/25px-Volleyball_%28indoor%29_pictogram.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Volleyball_%28indoor%29_pictogram.svg/38px-Volleyball_%28indoor%29_pictogram.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Volleyball_%28indoor%29_pictogram.svg/50px-Volleyball_%28indoor%29_pictogram.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
        </a>
        <a href="/wiki/Volleyball" title="Volleyball">
         Volleyball
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       The
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_Longueau_M%C3%A9tropole_Volley-Ball&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens Longueau Métropole Volley-Ball (page does not exist)">
        Amiens Longueau Métropole Volley-Ball
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiens_Longueau_M%C3%A9tropole_Volley-Ball" title="fr:Amiens Longueau Métropole Volley-Ball">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (ALMVB) including women's first team plays in
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Championnat_de_France_d%27%C3%89lite_F%C3%A9minine_de_volley-ball&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Championnat de France d'Élite Féminine de volley-ball (page does not exist)">
        Women's Elite Division
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnat_de_France_d%27%C3%89lite_F%C3%A9minine_de_volley-ball" title="fr:Championnat de France d'Élite Féminine de volley-ball">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (D2) and the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_M%C3%A9tropole_Volley-Ball&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens Métropole Volley-Ball (page does not exist)">
        Amiens Métropole Volley-Ball
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiens_M%C3%A9tropole_Volley-Ball" title="fr:Amiens Métropole Volley-Ball">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (AMVB) including the men's first team plays in
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Championnat_de_France_d%27%C3%89lite_Masculine_de_volley-ball&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Championnat de France d'Élite Masculine de volley-ball (page does not exist)">
        Nationale 1
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championnat_de_France_d%27%C3%89lite_Masculine_de_volley-ball" title="fr:Championnat de France d'Élite Masculine de volley-ball">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (D3).
      </p>
      <ul class="gallery mw-gallery-packed">
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">
        <div style="width: 162px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 160px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">

           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           The
           <a href="/wiki/Colis%C3%A9um" title="Coliséum">
            Coliséum
           </a>
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 162px">
        <div style="width: 162px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 160px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Stadlic3.JPG">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="1704" data-file-width="2272" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Stadlic3.JPG/240px-Stadlic3.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Stadlic3.JPG/360px-Stadlic3.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Stadlic3.JPG/480px-Stadlic3.JPG 2x" width="160"/>

          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/Stade_de_la_Licorne" title="Stade de la Licorne">
            Stade de la Licorne
           </a>
           .
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 92px">
        <div style="width: 92px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 90px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Gothiques-Amiens-2008.jpg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="2080" data-file-width="1560" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/Gothiques-Amiens-2008.jpg/135px-Gothiques-Amiens-2008.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/Gothiques-Amiens-2008.jpg/202px-Gothiques-Amiens-2008.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/Gothiques-Amiens-2008.jpg/270px-Gothiques-Amiens-2008.jpg 2x" width="90"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           The
           <a href="/wiki/Gothiques_d%27Amiens" title="Gothiques d'Amiens">
            Gothiques d'Amiens
           </a>
           in 2008
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
       <li class="gallerybox" style="width: 98.666666666667px">
        <div style="width: 98.666666666667px">
         <div class="thumb" style="width: 96.666666666667px;">
          <div style="margin:0px auto;">
           <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:J%C3%A9r%C3%A9my_Stravius.jpg">
            <img alt="" data-file-height="286" data-file-width="230" height="120" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7d/J%C3%A9r%C3%A9my_Stravius.jpg/145px-J%C3%A9r%C3%A9my_Stravius.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7d/J%C3%A9r%C3%A9my_Stravius.jpg/217px-J%C3%A9r%C3%A9my_Stravius.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/7d/J%C3%A9r%C3%A9my_Stravius.jpg 2x" width="97"/>
           </a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="gallerytext">
          <p>
           <a href="/wiki/J%C3%A9r%C3%A9my_Stravius" title="Jérémy Stravius">
            Jérémy Stravius
           </a>
           , member of the
           <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_M%C3%A9tropole_Natation&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens Métropole Natation (page does not exist)">
            Amiens Métropole Natation
           </a>
           <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
            (
            <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiens_M%C3%A9tropole_Natation" title="fr:Amiens Métropole Natation">
             fr
            </a>
            )
           </span>
           club
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Since the start of the
       <a href="/wiki/Tour_de_France" title="Tour de France">
        Tour de France
       </a>
       in 1903, Amiens has hosted the start of a stage on ten occasions (
       <a href="/wiki/1932_Tour_de_France" title="1932 Tour de France">
        1932
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/1962_Tour_de_France" title="1962 Tour de France">
        1962
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/1964_Tour_de_France" title="1964 Tour de France">
        1964
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/1967_Tour_de_France" title="1967 Tour de France">
        1967
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/1970_Tour_de_France" title="1970 Tour de France">
        1970
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/1971_Tour_de_France" title="1971 Tour de France">
        1971
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/1975_Tour_de_France" title="1975 Tour de France">
        1975
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/1979_Tour_de_France" title="1979 Tour de France">
        1979
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/1999_Tour_de_France" title="1999 Tour de France">
        1999
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/2004_Tour_de_France" title="2004 Tour de France">
        2004
       </a>
       ) and the stage finish nine times (1932, 1962, 1964, 1967, 1970, 1971, 1975,
       <a href="/wiki/1993_Tour_de_France" title="1993 Tour de France">
        1993
       </a>
       , 1999). Amiens will host the finish of Stage 5 of the
       <a href="/wiki/2015_Tour_de_France" title="2015 Tour de France">
        2015 Tour de France
       </a>
       on 8 July.
      </p>
      <p>
       On 29 April 2006, Amiens hosted the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/F%C3%A9d%C3%A9ration_Fran%C3%A7aise_de_Hockey_sur_Glace" title="Fédération Française de Hockey sur Glace">
        French Federation of ice hockey
       </a>
       created during the World Cup of Ice Hockey of Group B (antechamber of the world elite) organised in Amiens at the same time. It is now installed at
       <a href="/wiki/Issy-les-Moulineaux" title="Issy-les-Moulineaux">
        Issy-les-Moulineaux
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       Each 15 August at the
       <i>
        Parc de la Hotoie
       </i>
       , the city receives the final stages of the Picardy sports and in particular those of the most emblematic, traditional Picard sport: The
       <a href="/wiki/Ballon_au_poing" title="Ballon au poing">
        Ballon au poing
       </a>
       . This Picard game is played by teams of six. To be able to hit the ball, players surround their hand and their wrist with a strip of canvas or leather.
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Media">
        Media
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=43" title="Edit section: Media">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Newspapers_and_news_magazines">
        Newspapers and news magazines
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=44" title="Edit section: Newspapers and news magazines">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Le_Courrier_picard&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Le Courrier picard (page does not exist)">
         <i>
          Le Courrier picard
         </i>
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Le_Courrier_picard" title="fr:Le Courrier picard">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        , principal regional newspaper, founded in 1944. Its headquarters are located at 29
        <i>
         Rue de la République
        </i>
        (it sold 64,587 copies in 2013).
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-64">
         <a href="#cite_note-64">
          [57]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Fakir_(journal)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Fakir (journal) (page does not exist)">
         <i>
          Fakir
         </i>
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fakir_(journal)" title="fr:Fakir (journal)">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        , an independent journal, founded in Amiens in 1999 by
        <a href="/wiki/Fran%C3%A7ois_Ruffin" title="François Ruffin">
         François Ruffin
        </a>
        .
       </li>
       <li>
        <i>
         Le Télescope d'Amiens
        </i>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Pure_play" title="Pure play">
         pure player
        </a>
        of local information, in publication from September 2012 to April 2014.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-65">
         <a href="#cite_note-65">
          [58]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Free newspapers
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Metro_International" title="Metro International">
         Metro
        </a>
       </i>
       and
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/20_minutes_(France)" title="20 minutes (France)">
         20 minutes
        </a>
       </i>
       are distributed in the city, including in
       <a href="/wiki/Gare_d%27Amiens" title="Gare d'Amiens">
        Amiens railway station
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       Since 7 February 1996,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HISTJDA_66-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-HISTJDA-66">
         [59]
        </a>
       </sup>
       the
       <a href="/wiki/Communaut%C3%A9_d%27agglom%C3%A9ration_Amiens_M%C3%A9tropole" title="Communauté d'agglomération Amiens Métropole">
        Communauté d'agglomération Amiens Métropole
       </a>
       distributes a free weekly local newspaper: JDA (
       <i>
        Journal des Amiénois
       </i>
       ). This publication, which appears every Wednesday, is distributed to all homes in the metropolitan area and is made available in public places (taken at about 95,000 copies)
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HISTJDA_66-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-HISTJDA-66">
         [59]
        </a>
       </sup>
       as well as on the internet site of the city in its digital version. Over time, the journal has evolved through various forms. Carried out by the Directorate of communication of Amiens Métropole, the latest form dates to 16 January 2015.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HISTJDA_66-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-HISTJDA-66">
         [59]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In addition to the JDA which is attached to information on the whole of the territory of Amiens Métropole, the city has also had monthly publications specific to the city, which no longer exist today:
       <i>
        Amiensville
       </i>
       then
       <i>
        Amiens Forum
       </i>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HISTJDA_66-3">
        <a href="#cite_note-HISTJDA-66">
         [59]
        </a>
       </sup>
       (from April 2009 to June 2014).
      </p>
      <p>
       The people of Amiens have other sources of information on their territory, such as the monthly publication of the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Picardy_regional_Council&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Picardy regional Council (page does not exist)">
        Picardy regional Council
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conseil_r%C3%A9gional_de_Picardie" title="fr:Conseil régional de Picardie">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ,
       <i>
        Agir en Picardie
       </i>
       . The
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Departmental_Council_of_the_Somme&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Departmental Council of the Somme (page does not exist)">
        Departmental Council of the Somme
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conseil_d%C3%A9partemental_de_la_Somme" title="fr:Conseil départemental de la Somme">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       also sees its magazine distributed each month to the
       <a href="/wiki/Somme_(department)" title="Somme (department)">
        samariens
       </a>
       homes,
       <i>
        Vivre en Somme
       </i>
       . Since 2006, the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Regional_tourism_committee&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Regional tourism committee (page does not exist)">
        regional tourism committee
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comit%C3%A9_r%C3%A9gional_de_tourisme" title="fr:Comité régional de tourisme">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       of
       <a href="/wiki/Picardy" title="Picardy">
        Picardy
       </a>
       publishes
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Esprit_de_Picardie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Esprit de Picardie (page does not exist)">
        <i>
         Esprit de Picardie
        </i>
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Esprit_de_Picardie" title="fr:Esprit de Picardie">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , a travel magazine on the Picardy region, every six months.
      </p>
      <p>
       Several associative journals and specialised magazines are also distributed free of charge in public places:
       <i>
        L'Écho des Amphis
       </i>
       (student monthly),
       <i>
        Bon Temps
       </i>
       (quarterly magazine dedicated to the culture of Amiens and the art of living),
       <i>
        Style &amp; Co Amiens
       </i>
       (deco magazine, trends and lifestyle),
       <i>
        Night Clubbing Magazine
       </i>
       (magazine of the nightlife in Amiens),
       <i>
        Picardie la Gazette
       </i>
       (economics weekly),
       <i>
        Entreprises 80
       </i>
       (monthly of the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Chamber_of_commerce_and_industry_of_Amiens-Picardie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Chamber of commerce and industry of Amiens-Picardie (page does not exist)">
        Chamber of commerce and industry of Amiens-Picardie
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chambre_de_commerce_et_d%27industrie_d%27Amiens-Picardie" title="fr:Chambre de commerce et d'industrie d'Amiens-Picardie">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ).
      </p>
      <h4>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Audiovisual">
        Audiovisual
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=45" title="Edit section: Audiovisual">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h4>
      <h5>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Television_channels">
        Television channels
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=46" title="Edit section: Television channels">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h5>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:France_3_Picardie_building_in_Amiens_-_front_with_logo.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1704" data-file-width="2272" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/France_3_Picardie_building_in_Amiens_-_front_with_logo.jpg/220px-France_3_Picardie_building_in_Amiens_-_front_with_logo.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/France_3_Picardie_building_in_Amiens_-_front_with_logo.jpg/330px-France_3_Picardie_building_in_Amiens_-_front_with_logo.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/France_3_Picardie_building_in_Amiens_-_front_with_logo.jpg/440px-France_3_Picardie_building_in_Amiens_-_front_with_logo.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:France_3_Picardie_building_in_Amiens_-_front_with_logo.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The headquarters of
         <a href="/wiki/France_3_Picardie" title="France 3 Picardie">
          France 3 Picardie
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <ul>
       <li>
        The headquarters of
        <a href="/wiki/France_3_Picardie" title="France 3 Picardie">
         France 3 Picardie
        </a>
        (channel among other broadcasting programming
        <i>
         Picardie Matin
        </i>
        [Picardy Morning]) is located on
        <i>
         Rue Roger Martin du Gard
        </i>
        , to the north of the city.
       </li>
       <li>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Canal_Nord&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Canal Nord (page does not exist)">
         Canal Nord
        </a>
        , local channel created in the mid-1980s in the northern districts, now extended to the entire city via the Wibox network;
       </li>
       <li>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=W%C3%A9o_Picardie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Wéo Picardie (page does not exist)">
         Wéo Picardie
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/W%C3%A9o_Picardie" title="fr:Wéo Picardie">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        , (broadcast suspended since 8 January 2014).
       </li>
       <li>
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=TV_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="TV Amiens (page does not exist)">
         TV Amiens
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/TV_Amiens" title="fr:TV Amiens">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        , a local television channel on the internet.
       </li>
       <li>
        <i>
         WebTV Picardie
        </i>
        , an internet television channel of the
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Regional_Council_of_Picardie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Regional Council of Picardie (page does not exist)">
         Regional Council of Picardie
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conseil_r%C3%A9gional_de_Picardie" title="fr:Conseil régional de Picardie">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        .
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h5>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="FM_radio_stations">
        FM radio stations
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=47" title="Edit section: FM radio stations">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h5>
      <p>
       Most of the national radio stations broadcast their programmes in the Amiens area. Can be added to
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=France_Bleu_Picardie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="France Bleu Picardie (page does not exist)">
        France Bleu Picardie
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_Bleu_Picardie" title="fr:France Bleu Picardie">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (100.2 MHz) and local stations
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Radio_Campus_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Radio Campus Amiens (page does not exist)">
        Radio Campus Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radio_Campus_Amiens" title="fr:Radio Campus Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (87.7 MHz) and
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Radio_Galaxie_programme_%C3%89vasion&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Radio Galaxie programme Évasion (page does not exist)">
        Radio Galaxie programme Évasion
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radio_Galaxie_programme_%C3%89vasion" title="fr:Radio Galaxie programme Évasion">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       (97.7 MHz).
      </p>

         </a>
