          </a>
         </div>
         Detail of the
         <a href="/wiki/Son_et_lumi%C3%A8re_(show)" title="Son et lumière (show)">
          son et lumière
         </a>
         show of
         <i>
          Amiens, la cathédrale en couleurs
         </i>
         .
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:La_Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens_2013.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="3904" data-file-width="2844" height="302" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/La_Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens_2013.jpg/220px-La_Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens_2013.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/La_Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens_2013.jpg/330px-La_Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens_2013.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/La_Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens_2013.jpg/440px-La_Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens_2013.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:La_Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens_2013.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The
         <i>
          Grande Réderie d'Amiens
         </i>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:La_fa%C3%A7ade_de_la_Cath%C3%A9drale_Notre-Dame_d%27Amiens_illumin%C3%A9e_en_tout_couleur.JPG">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="4592" data-file-width="3056" height="331" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/La_fa%C3%A7ade_de_la_Cath%C3%A9drale_Notre-Dame_d%27Amiens_illumin%C3%A9e_en_tout_couleur.JPG/220px-La_fa%C3%A7ade_de_la_Cath%C3%A9drale_Notre-Dame_d%27Amiens_illumin%C3%A9e_en_tout_couleur.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/La_fa%C3%A7ade_de_la_Cath%C3%A9drale_Notre-Dame_d%27Amiens_illumin%C3%A9e_en_tout_couleur.JPG/330px-La_fa%C3%A7ade_de_la_Cath%C3%A9drale_Notre-Dame_d%27Amiens_illumin%C3%A9e_en_tout_couleur.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/11/La_fa%C3%A7ade_de_la_Cath%C3%A9drale_Notre-Dame_d%27Amiens_illumin%C3%A9e_en_tout_couleur.JPG/440px-La_fa%C3%A7ade_de_la_Cath%C3%A9drale_Notre-Dame_d%27Amiens_illumin%C3%A9e_en_tout_couleur.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:La_fa%C3%A7ade_de_la_Cath%C3%A9drale_Notre-Dame_d%27Amiens_illumin%C3%A9e_en_tout_couleur.JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <i>
          Amiens, la cathédrale en couleurs
         </i>
         .
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:F%C3%AAte_au_bord_de_l%27eau_2013_%C3%A0_Amiens.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="4000" data-file-width="3000" height="293" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/47/F%C3%AAte_au_bord_de_l%27eau_2013_%C3%A0_Amiens.jpg/220px-F%C3%AAte_au_bord_de_l%27eau_2013_%C3%A0_Amiens.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/47/F%C3%AAte_au_bord_de_l%27eau_2013_%C3%A0_Amiens.jpg/330px-F%C3%AAte_au_bord_de_l%27eau_2013_%C3%A0_Amiens.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/47/F%C3%AAte_au_bord_de_l%27eau_2013_%C3%A0_Amiens.jpg/440px-F%C3%AAte_au_bord_de_l%27eau_2013_%C3%A0_Amiens.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:F%C3%AAte_au_bord_de_l%27eau_2013_%C3%A0_Amiens.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The
         <i>
          Fête au bord de l'eau
         </i>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Vue_generale.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="476" data-file-width="900" height="116" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Vue_generale.jpg/220px-Vue_generale.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Vue_generale.jpg/330px-Vue_generale.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Vue_generale.jpg/440px-Vue_generale.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Vue_generale.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The 13th
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Rendez-vous_de_la_bande_dessin%C3%A9e_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Rendez-vous de la bande dessinée d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
          <i>
           Rendez-Vous de la Bande Dessinée d'Amiens
          </i>
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rendez-vous_de_la_bande_dessin%C3%A9e_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Rendez-vous de la bande dessinée d'Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         in 2008.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:March%C3%A9_de_No%C3%ABl_d%27Amiens.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="4000" data-file-width="3000" height="293" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/54/March%C3%A9_de_No%C3%ABl_d%27Amiens.jpg/220px-March%C3%A9_de_No%C3%ABl_d%27Amiens.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/54/March%C3%A9_de_No%C3%ABl_d%27Amiens.jpg/330px-March%C3%A9_de_No%C3%ABl_d%27Amiens.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/54/March%C3%A9_de_No%C3%ABl_d%27Amiens.jpg/440px-March%C3%A9_de_No%C3%ABl_d%27Amiens.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:March%C3%A9_de_No%C3%ABl_d%27Amiens.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The
         <a href="/wiki/Carnival_of_Binche" title="Carnival of Binche">
          Gilles of Binche
         </a>
         at the inauguration of the Christmas market in 2013.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Un_%C3%A9t%C3%A9_en_musique_Amiens.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="3000" data-file-width="4000" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Un_%C3%A9t%C3%A9_en_musique_Amiens.jpg/220px-Un_%C3%A9t%C3%A9_en_musique_Amiens.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Un_%C3%A9t%C3%A9_en_musique_Amiens.jpg/330px-Un_%C3%A9t%C3%A9_en_musique_Amiens.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Un_%C3%A9t%C3%A9_en_musique_Amiens.jpg/440px-Un_%C3%A9t%C3%A9_en_musique_Amiens.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Un_%C3%A9t%C3%A9_en_musique_Amiens.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The
         <i>
          Un été en musique
         </i>
         event at the Jules Bocquet bandstand.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <table class="wikitable" style="text-align:left;margin:1em auto">
       <caption>
        Annual Events
       </caption>
       <tr>
        <th>
         Month
        </th>
        <th>
         Event
        </th>
        <th>
         Subject
        </th>
        <th>
         Number of editions (In 2015)
        </th>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         January
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Festival Tendance Europe
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This festival, organised by the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Maison_de_la_culture_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Maison de la culture d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
          Maison de la culture d'Amiens
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maison_de_la_culture_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Maison de la culture d'Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         , is dedicated to contemporary creation. Programming highlights emerging European artists in a variety of areas: Theatre, dance, music, circus arts and visual arts.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         9
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         February
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Salon des Antiquaires
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         The
         <i>
          Salon des Antiquaires
         </i>
         of the city is held, every year, at the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Megacity_of_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Megacity of Amiens (page does not exist)">
          Megacity
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%A9gacit%C3%A9_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Mégacité d'Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         . Its reputation makes it one of the most important events of its kind in the north of the France.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         12
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th rowspan="2">
         March
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Festival du jeu et de l'imaginaire : À toi de Jouer
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This festival is dedicated to fun activities: Board games, card games, role plays, video games, comics, manga, etc. Many tournaments are organized during this event which takes place at
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Megacity_of_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Megacity of Amiens (page does not exist)">
          Megacity
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megacity_of_Amiens" title="fr:Megacity of Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         . The first edition was held on 12 and 13 May 2012 with
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Simon_Astier&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Simon Astier (page does not exist)">
          Simon Astier
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simon_Astier" title="fr:Simon Astier">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         for sponsor.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         4
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Salon du chocolat et gourmandises en Picardie
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         For three days at the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Megacity_of_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Megacity of Amiens (page does not exist)">
          Megacity
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megacity_of_Amiens" title="fr:Megacity of Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         , the fair offers demonstrations, parades, contests around the theme of chocolate and food in general.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         5
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         April
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%E2%80%99Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Grande Réderie d’Amiens (page does not exist)">
          <i>
           Grande réderie de printemps
          </i>
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%E2%80%99Amiens" title="fr:Grande Réderie d’Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
        </td>
        <td>
         The
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%E2%80%99Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Grande Réderie d’Amiens (page does not exist)">
          <i>
           Grande réderie de printemps
          </i>
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grande_R%C3%A9derie_d%E2%80%99Amiens" title="fr:Grande Réderie d’Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         (
         <a href="/wiki/Jumble_sale" title="Jumble sale">
          jumble sale
         </a>
         ) is a popular event that takes place twice a year: in spring (the last Sunday in April) and autumn (the first Sunday in October). After the
         <a href="/wiki/Braderie_de_Lille" title="Braderie de Lille">
          Braderie de Lille
         </a>
         , the Réderie of Amiens is the second largest event of its kind in France. It hosts more than 2,000 professional traders and individuals as well as 80,000 to 100,000 visitors to each edition.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-159">
          <a href="#cite_note-159">
           [145]
          </a>
         </sup>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         -
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         May
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Leitura furiosa
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This festival, organized by the association "Cardan", offers various free activities relating to the world of words: Workshops calligraphy, typography, games writing,
         <a href="/wiki/Poetry_slam" title="Poetry slam">
          slam
         </a>
         and shows.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         23
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th rowspan="4">
         June
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Foire Exposition de Picardie
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         It takes place at the park of the congress and exhibitions of Amiens, the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Megacity_of_Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Megacity of Amiens (page does not exist)">
          Megacity
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megacity_of_Amiens" title="fr:Megacity of Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         . During nine days, it hosts approximately 50,000 visitors, 300 exhibitors and more than 20 activities.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-160">
          <a href="#cite_note-160">
           [146]
          </a>
         </sup>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         76
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Rendez-vous_de_la_bande_dessin%C3%A9e_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Rendez-vous de la bande dessinée d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
          <i>
           Rendez-Vous de la Bande Dessinée d'Amiens
          </i>
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rendez-vous_de_la_bande_dessin%C3%A9e_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Rendez-vous de la bande dessinée d'Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
        </td>
        <td>
         This comic strip festival, organised by the association "Explorers on the bubble", is one of the most important
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Festival_de_bande_dessin%C3%A9e&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Festival de bande dessinée (page does not exist)">
          comic strip festivals in France
         </a>
         .
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-161">
          <a href="#cite_note-161">
           [147]
          </a>
         </sup>
         Created in 1996, it takes place each first weekend in June, in the University Library of the Cathedral hub. Various activities in connection with the festival are also organized at different places in the city.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         20
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Fête dans la ville
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This international festival of
         <a href="/wiki/Street_theatre" title="Street theatre">
          street theatre
         </a>
         is also known under the name of "The street is in Amiens". Created in 1977, it invited 20 companies for four days of performances, parades, fairground theatre, circus, etc. in the streets of the city.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         38
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Marché sur l'eau
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         Once a year, in the context of the "Festival in the city", the walking on water takes place as formerly. Growers (gardeners) in traditional costumes down the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Somme_(River)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Somme (River) (page does not exist)">
          Somme
         </a>
         with their boats loaded with fruit and vegetables from the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Hortillonnages&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Hortillonnages (page does not exist)">
          hortillonnages
         </a>
         .
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         -
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         June to July
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Foire de la Saint Jean
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         It is the largest funfair in the north of the France.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-162">
          <a href="#cite_note-162">
           [148]
          </a>
         </sup>
         It takes place during 3 weeks between mid-June and mid-July on the esplanade of
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Parc_de_la_Hotoie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Parc de la Hotoie (page does not exist)">
          Hotoie
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parc_de_la_Hotoie" title="fr:Parc de la Hotoie">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         .
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         -
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th rowspan="2">
         June to September
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Amiens_Cathedral#Renaissance_polychrome_sculpture" title="Amiens Cathedral">
           Amiens, la cathédrale en couleurs
          </a>
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         Created in 1999, this
         <a href="/wiki/Son_et_lumi%C3%A8re_(show)" title="Son et lumière (show)">
          son et lumière
         </a>
         show is the first world.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-163">
          <a href="#cite_note-163">
           [149]
          </a>
         </sup>
         Daily from mid-June to mid-September as well as in December, in the dark, the medieval colors of the portals of the façade of the
         <a href="/wiki/Amiens_Cathedral" title="Amiens Cathedral">
          cathedral
         </a>
         are reborn thanks to projections of digital images. Since its inception, nearly two million people have attended the free event.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         15
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Un été en musique
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This summer event, conducted from June to September, offers a series of free concerts outdoors (at
         <i>
          Place René Goblet
         </i>
         and
         <i>
          Place Gambetta
         </i>
         , and the Jules Bocquet bandstand). Programming is mainly of local artists.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         -
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         June to October
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Festival Art, villes et paysage - Hortillonnages Amiens
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This festival, organized by the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Maison_de_la_culture_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Maison de la culture d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
          Maison de la culture d'Amiens
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maison_de_la_culture_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Maison de la culture d'Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         , was born in 2010 under the heading "Imagine it now". He invited from young landscape, visual artists, architects and designers involved in the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Hortillonnages&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Hortillonnages (page does not exist)">
          hortillonnages
         </a>
         . In total, twenty artists facilities and landscaped gardens are located in several places in the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Hortillonnages_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Hortillonnages d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
          "hortillonnages"
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hortillonnages_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Hortillonnages d'Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         . These unusual works (floating sculptures, reinvented huts, diverted gardens, revisited gardens etc.) are visible either by walking track, boats from June to October.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         6
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th rowspan="2">
         July
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Voyage au cœur de l'été
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         The event, which takes place every July in the
         <i>
          Espace Dewailly
         </i>
         . The programming consists of live performances around world cultures, traditions, folklore and modernity.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         11
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Bal du 14 juillet
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This ball takes place on the
         <i>
          Place de l'hôtel de ville
         </i>
         . It is followed by a fireworks display at the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Parc_de_la_Hotoie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Parc de la Hotoie (page does not exist)">
          parc de la Hotoie
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/parc_de_la_Hotoie" title="fr:parc de la Hotoie">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         .
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         -
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         July to August
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Un été à Amiens
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This summer event, conducted by the city hall of Amiens, brings together four concepts spread across three sites in the city: "Amiens-les-Bains" (children) and "Beach Attitude" (adolescents) in the Parc Saint Pierre, "Zen Attitude" in
         <i>
          Place Gambetta
         </i>
         and "Sportez-vous bien" at Grand Marais.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         2
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th rowspan="2">
         August
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Défi Jules Verne
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This event, also known as "Montgolfiade", commemorates the first balloon flight (1873) of the most illustrious of the Amiens adoption:
         <a href="/wiki/Jules_Verne" title="Jules Verne">
          Jules Verne
         </a>
         . Its uniqueness lies in the take-off of many balloons and unusual machines (between 20 and 30) from the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Parc_de_la_Hotoie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Parc de la Hotoie (page does not exist)">
          Parc de la Hotoie
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parc_de_la_Hotoie" title="fr:Parc de la Hotoie">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         . Music and readings of excerpts from novels by
         <a href="/wiki/Jules_Verne" title="Jules Verne">
          Jules Verne
         </a>
         accompany their flight in the sky of the city. Subject to favourable weather conditions, this event takes place every month of August.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         10
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Bal de la libération
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This festive event, which is held at the
         <i>
          Place de l'hôtel de ville
         </i>
         , celebrates the liberation of the city on 31 August 1944. It joins the various commemorations and tributes traditionally organised there on this day.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         6
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         September
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Fête au bord de l'eau
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This traditional
         <a href="/wiki/Festival" title="Festival">
          festival
         </a>
         , organised by the association "Jacobins Traditions and history", plunges the historic quarter of Saint-Leu into a medieval atmosphere for two days: Market and medieval camps, trades of yesteryear, parades in the streets and on the water, activities, etc. It is on this occasion that runs the popular tournament of
         <a href="/wiki/Water_jousting" title="Water jousting">
          water jousting
         </a>
         of the city. Created in 1990, this free event takes place every second weekend of September and gathers an average of 80,000 visitors.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         25
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th rowspan="3">
         October
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Grande_r%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Grande réderie d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
          <i>
           Grande réderie d'automne
          </i>
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grande_r%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Grande réderie d'Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
        </td>
        <td>
         The autumn edition of the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Grande_r%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Grande réderie d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
          Grande réderie d'Amiens
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grande_r%C3%A9derie_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Grande réderie d'Amiens">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         is held every first Sunday in October.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         -
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Ô mon Cloître
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         Evolution of the
         <a href="/wiki/Nuit_Blanche" title="Nuit Blanche">
          Nuit Blanche
         </a>
         (9 editions), this event is dedicated to the performing arts and visual arts and is held in the cloister of the grey nuns.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         1
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Festiv'Art
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This festival, held since 2006 by the association of "Free radicals", allows regional, national and international artists to find themselves on the same stage for an evening which is followed by street arts and circus, theatre, concerts and graphic services.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         8
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th rowspan="2">
         November
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens_International_Film_Festival&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Amiens International Film Festival (page does not exist)">
           Amiens International Film Festival
          </a>
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This international film festival ranks among the five largest film festivals in France.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-164">
          <a href="#cite_note-164">
           [150]
          </a>
         </sup>
         Created in
         <a href="/wiki/1980_in_film" title="1980 in film">
          1980
         </a>
         , it is held for nine days in November and records more than 60,000 entries each year.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         35
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Picardie Mouv
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         This festival of
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Musiques_actuelles&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Musiques actuelles (page does not exist)">
          musiques actuelles
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/musiques_actuelles" title="fr:musiques actuelles">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         , organized by the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Conseil_r%C3%A9gional_de_Picardie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Conseil régional de Picardie (page does not exist)">
          Picardy regional Council
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conseil_r%C3%A9gional_de_Picardie" title="fr:Conseil régional de Picardie">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         , offers eclectic programming that mixes a collage of artists of international, national and local groups.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         10
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th rowspan="2">
         December
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Christmas Market of Amiens
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         The largest Christmas market in the north of France,
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-165">
          <a href="#cite_note-165">
           [151]
          </a>
         </sup>
         it attracts over one million visitors each year.
         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-166">
          <a href="#cite_note-166">
           [152]
          </a>
         </sup>
         The market consists of approximately 135 chalets in the city center and offers various animations (a
         <a href="/wiki/Son_et_lumi%C3%A8re_(show)" title="Son et lumière (show)">
          Son et lumière
         </a>
         show,
         <a href="/wiki/Amiens_Cathedral#Renaissance_polychrome_sculpture" title="Amiens Cathedral">
          Amiens, la cathédrale en couleurs
         </a>
         , Ferris wheel, ice rink, village of Santa Claus, parades, rides, etc.).
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         18
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Amiens_Cathedral#Renaissance_polychrome_sculpture" title="Amiens Cathedral">
           Amiens, la cathédrale en couleurs
          </a>
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         Winter Edition of the
         <a href="/wiki/Son_et_lumi%C3%A8re_(show)" title="Son et lumière (show)">
          Son et lumière
         </a>
         show of the cathedral.
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         -
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <table class="wikitable" style="text-align:left;margin:1em auto">
       <caption>
        Multi-annual Events
       </caption>

        </th>

        </th>
        <th>
         Last edition (Number)
        </th>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th>
         March
        </th>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         <i>
          Rencontres internationales Jules Verne
         </i>
        </td>
        <td>
         These meetings, organised by the
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Centre_international_Jules-Verne&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Centre international Jules-Verne (page does not exist)">
          Centre international Jules-Verne
         </a>
         <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
          (
          <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centre_international_Jules-Verne" title="fr:Centre international Jules-Verne">
           fr
          </a>
          )
         </span>
         , are held every two years since 1997.
        </td>
        <td>
         Biannual
        </td>
        <td style="text-align:center;">
         2015 (10)
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Amiens_and_music">
        Amiens and music
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=89" title="Edit section: Amiens and music">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:The_rabeats_sly_flamm_marcelo.JPG">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="480" data-file-width="640" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/The_rabeats_sly_flamm_marcelo.JPG/220px-The_rabeats_sly_flamm_marcelo.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/The_rabeats_sly_flamm_marcelo.JPG/330px-The_rabeats_sly_flamm_marcelo.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/The_rabeats_sly_flamm_marcelo.JPG/440px-The_rabeats_sly_flamm_marcelo.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:The_rabeats_sly_flamm_marcelo.JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The Rabeats
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Even if it rarely achieves national notoriety (with the notable exceptions of
       <a href="/wiki/Les_Fatals_Picards" title="Les Fatals Picards">
        Les Fatals Picards
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=The_Rabeats&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="The Rabeats (page does not exist)">
        The Rabeats
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rabeats" title="fr:The Rabeats">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Olympe_(singer)" title="Olympe (singer)">
        Olympe
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Albin_de_la_Simone" title="Albin de la Simone">
        Albin de la Simone
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Disiz" title="Disiz">
        Disiz
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Rokia_Traor%C3%A9" title="Rokia Traoré">
        Rokia Traoré
       </a>
       ), the Amiens music scene is active and developed. In this dynamic, the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Nouvelle_sc%C3%A8ne_rock_fran%C3%A7aise&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Nouvelle scène rock française (page does not exist)">
        New French Rock
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nouvelle_sc%C3%A8ne_rock_fran%C3%A7aise" title="fr:Nouvelle scène rock française">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       scene holds a central place and is organised around a collective as
       <i>
        Amiens Burning
       </i>
       , which is responsible for networking the breeding ground for the local rock scene, to accompany it in its projects, and organise concerts.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-167">
        <a href="#cite_note-167">
         [153]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Since their creation,
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=La_Lune_des_Pirates&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="La Lune des Pirates (page does not exist)">
        La Lune des Pirates
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Lune_des_Pirates" title="fr:La Lune des Pirates">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       or Cité Carter also provide support to the local scene. For example, the Cité Carter each year produces a compilation with the groups which repeat within its structure.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-168">
        <a href="#cite_note-168">
         [154]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Here is an overview of the Amiens music scene:
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Rock: The Rabeats (
        <a href="/wiki/Cover_band" title="Cover band">
         cover band
        </a>
        of
        <a href="/wiki/The_Beatles" title="The Beatles">
         The Beatles
        </a>
        ), The Beyonders, Molly's, Sobo, The Void, Violent Scaredy Cats, Elegant Fall, Gene Trio
       </li>
       <li>
        Electro: The Name (who created the soundtrack of the series
        <a href="/wiki/Bref" title="Bref">
         Bref
        </a>
        ), The Blue
       </li>
       <li>
        Pop:
        <a href="/wiki/Olympe_(singer)" title="Olympe (singer)">
         Olympe
        </a>
        , Nathaniel Isaac Smog,
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Ribo_(band)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Ribo (band) (page does not exist)">
         Ribo
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ribo" title="fr:Ribo">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
       </li>
       <li>
        Metal: Anorak, DSK, Vakarm, Decline Of Humanity, Altered beast, Infected Society
       </li>
       <li>
        Hip Hop/Rap:
        <a href="/wiki/Disiz" title="Disiz">
         Disiz
        </a>
        (born in Amiens), D.S.C. (Dirty South Crew), Lj Crackus
       </li>
       <li>
        French singers:
        <a href="/wiki/Albin_de_la_Simone" title="Albin de la Simone">
         Albin de la Simone
        </a>
        (born in Amiens),
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=EmilieAnneCharlotte&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="EmilieAnneCharlotte (page does not exist)">
         EmilieAnneCharlotte
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        World Music:
        <a href="/wiki/Rokia_Traor%C3%A9" title="Rokia Traoré">
         Rokia Traoré
        </a>
        (Malian-born singer who lived in Amiens in the 1990s)
       </li>
       <li>
        Multiple genres:
        <a href="/wiki/Les_Fatals_Picards" title="Les Fatals Picards">
         Les Fatals Picards
        </a>
        , Zic Zazou (group of nine musicians created in 1982 and winner of La Grande Battle in November 2012)
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       Classical music is represented by the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Orchestre_de_Picardie&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Orchestre de Picardie (page does not exist)">
        Orchestre de Picardie
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orchestre_de_Picardie" title="fr:Orchestre de Picardie">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       and the University Orchestra of Picardy. Vocal practice is represented by the Regional Choir of Picardy, the University Choir of Picardie, and the Choir of France Picardy.
      </p>
      <p>
       Once can also include the Harmony Saint-Pierre, a
       <a href="/wiki/Fanfare" title="Fanfare">
        fanfare
       </a>
       of 70 musicians, which has become a local institution since its inception in 1894.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-169">
        <a href="#cite_note-169">
         [155]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The city has the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Conservatoire_%C3%A0_rayonnement_r%C3%A9gional_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Conservatoire à rayonnement régional d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
        Conservatoire à rayonnement régional d'Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservatoire_%C3%A0_rayonnement_r%C3%A9gional_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Conservatoire à rayonnement régional d'Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , seat of strong musical activity (framed by 70 teachers, an administrative and technical team with an additional 20 people).
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-170">
        <a href="#cite_note-170">
         [156]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Amiens_and_literature">
        Amiens and literature
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=90" title="Edit section: Amiens and literature">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       Amiens saw rise, over the centuries, major writers.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-171">
        <a href="#cite_note-171">
         [157]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In the first half of the 17th century,
       <a href="/wiki/Vincent_Voiture" title="Vincent Voiture">
        Vincent Voiture
       </a>
       , poet and letter writer, was the darling of the
       <a href="/wiki/Pr%C3%A9cieuses" title="Précieuses">
        Précieuses
       </a>
       for the fluidity of his style. In 1634, he was member of the 1st
       <a href="/wiki/Acad%C3%A9mie_fran%C3%A7aise" title="Académie française">
        Académie française
       </a>
       . In 1678,
       <a href="/wiki/Charles_du_Fresne,_sieur_du_Cange" title="Charles du Fresne, sieur du Cange">
        Charles du Fresne, sieur du Cange
       </a>
       , nicknamed "the French
       <a href="/wiki/Marcus_Terentius_Varro" title="Marcus Terentius Varro">
        Varro
       </a>
       ", published his
       <i>
        Glossarium
       </i>
       in 3 volumes. This glossary of medieval Latin is still authoritative today. In 1750,
       <a href="/wiki/Jean-Baptiste-Louis_Gresset" title="Jean-Baptiste-Louis Gresset">
        Jean Baptiste Gresset
       </a>
       , playwright and poet, celebrated in his time and member of the
       <a href="/wiki/Acad%C3%A9mie_fran%C3%A7aise" title="Académie française">
        Académie française
       </a>
       , founded the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Acad%C3%A9mie_des_sciences,_des_lettres_et_des_arts_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Académie des sciences, des lettres et des arts d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
        Academy of Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acad%C3%A9mie_des_sciences,_des_lettres_et_des_arts_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Académie des sciences, des lettres et des arts d'Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       which is still active today and he was named perpetual president.
      </p>
      <p>
       In 1782, the Amiens native
       <a href="/wiki/Pierre_Choderlos_de_Laclos" title="Pierre Choderlos de Laclos">
        Choderlos de Laclos
       </a>
       published
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Les_Liaisons_dangereuses" title="Les Liaisons dangereuses">
         Les Liaisons dangereuses
        </a>
       </i>
       where he staged a depraved nobility. Considered one of the masterpieces of 18th-century literature, the book has toured the world and is known as an
       <a href="/wiki/Dangerous_Liaisons" title="Dangerous Liaisons">
        Oscar-winning film adaptation
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <table class="cquote pullquote" role="presentation" style="margin:auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: none; background-color: transparent; width: auto;">
       <tr>
        <td style="width: 20px; vertical-align: top; border: none; color: #B2B7F2; font-size: 40px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: bold; line-height: .6em; text-align: left; padding: 10px 10px;">
         “
        </td>
        <td style="vertical-align: top; border: none; padding: 4px 10px;">
         Here I am quite citizen of Amiens. It seems to me that I was born. I live very happy, although uncomfortable to work. Amiens is a wise city, even-tempered, and the company is friendly and literate. It is near Paris, close enough to have the highlights without unbearable noise and bustle.
        </td>
        <td style="width: 20px; vertical-align: bottom; border: none; color: #B2B7F2; font-size: 40px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: bold; line-height: .6em; text-align: right; padding: 10px 10px;">
         ”
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td class="cquotecite" colspan="3" style="border: none; padding-right: 4%; font-size: smaller; text-align: right;">
         <cite>
          —
          <a href="/wiki/Jules_Verne" title="Jules Verne">
           Jules Verne
          </a>
         </cite>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Firma_de_Julio_Verne.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="145" data-file-width="256" height="125" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Firma_de_Julio_Verne.svg/220px-Firma_de_Julio_Verne.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Firma_de_Julio_Verne.svg/330px-Firma_de_Julio_Verne.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Firma_de_Julio_Verne.svg/440px-Firma_de_Julio_Verne.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Firma_de_Julio_Verne.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The signature of Jules Verne
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       In the 19th century, there was a brilliant literary life around the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Acad%C3%A9mie_des_sciences,_des_lettres_et_des_arts_d%27Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Académie des sciences, des lettres et des arts d'Amiens (page does not exist)">
        Académie des sciences, des lettres et des arts d'Amiens
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acad%C3%A9mie_des_sciences,_des_lettres_et_des_arts_d%27Amiens" title="fr:Académie des sciences, des lettres et des arts d'Amiens">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       with historian
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Alb%C3%A9ric_de_Calonne&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Albéric de Calonne (page does not exist)">
        Albéric de Calonne
       </a>
       and the
       <a href="/wiki/Yvert_et_Tellier#Genealogy_of_the_Yvert_family" title="Yvert et Tellier">
        Yvert family
       </a>
       . However, the great name of Amiens literary life is
       <a href="/wiki/Jules_Verne" title="Jules Verne">
        Jules Verne
       </a>
       . He animated all intellectual activity, giving balls and parties, while his wife held a famous
       <a href="/wiki/Salon_(gathering)" title="Salon (gathering)">
        salon
       </a>
       . He often attended the library of the industrial society, which subscribed to numerous scientific journals. A member of the Academy of Sciences, Letters and Arts of Amiens from 8 March 1872, he was elected Director in 1875, and in 1881 and, on this occasion, he delivered several speeches of welcome, especially for one of his friends, Amiens cartoonist
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=G%C3%A9d%C3%A9on_Baril&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Gédéon Baril (page does not exist)">
        Gédéon Baril
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%A9d%C3%A9on_Baril" title="fr:Gédéon Baril">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , who signed illustrations of
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Dix_heures_en_chasse&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Dix heures en chasse (page does not exist)">
        Dix heures en chasse
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dix_heures_en_chasse" title="fr:Dix heures en chasse">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Pierre-Jules_Hetzel" title="Pierre-Jules Hetzel">
        Hetzel
       </a>
       . Engaged in local life, he was Councillor of Amiens from 1888 to 1904. He was closely interested in the affairs of the city, wrote many reports on the theatre and brought its support to the construction of the
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Cirque_Jules-Verne&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Cirque Jules-Verne (page does not exist)">
        municipal circus
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cirque_Jules-Verne" title="fr:Cirque Jules-Verne">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       Amiens does appear explicitly in his novels but there are however characteristic elements of the city such as the cathedral and the river. This is the case, for example, for the imaginary city of Ragz in
       <i>
        Le secret de Wilhem Storitz
       </i>
       . In the novel
       <i>
        Une fantaisie du docteur Ox
       </i>
       , the inhabitants of the fictional town of Virgamen, the Virgamenois, refer directly to the Amiénois and their prudent nature.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-172">
        <a href="#cite_note-172">
         [158]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       In 1875, he delivered before the Academy of Sciences, Letters and Arts of Amiens a speech entitled "An ideal city: Amiens in the year 2000" where he portrays himself wandering in a forward-thinking city of Amiens. Since then, the city has built a tourist route from this text.
      </p>
      <p>
       He died in Amiens in 1905, and he deeply marked the town's footprint, so that today many places, monuments and events bear his name. He rests at
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Cimeti%C3%A8re_de_La_Madeleine_(Amiens)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Cimetière de La Madeleine (Amiens) (page does not exist)">
        La Madeleine cemetery
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cimeti%C3%A8re_de_La_Madeleine_(Amiens)" title="fr:Cimetière de La Madeleine (Amiens)">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       where one can read on his tomb:
       <i>
        Vers l'immortalité et l’éternelle jeunesse.
       </i>
       [Towards immortality and eternal youth].
      </p>
      <table class="cquote pullquote" role="presentation" style="margin:auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: none; background-color: transparent; width: auto;">
       <tr>
        <td style="width: 20px; vertical-align: top; border: none; color: #B2B7F2; font-size: 40px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: bold; line-height: .6em; text-align: left; padding: 10px 10px;">
         “
        </td>
        <td style="vertical-align: top; border: none; padding: 4px 10px;">
         Such as it is with his distinctive smile, how much I love the Golden Virgin, with her smile of heavenly hostess; how much I love its home at the door of the Cathedral in its adornment exquisite and simple of hawthorns.
        </td>
        <td style="width: 20px; vertical-align: bottom; border: none; color: #B2B7F2; font-size: 40px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: bold; line-height: .6em; text-align: right; padding: 10px 10px;">
         ”
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td class="cquotecite" colspan="3" style="border: none; padding-right: 4%; font-size: smaller; text-align: right;">
         <cite>
          —
          <a href="/wiki/Marcel_Proust" title="Marcel Proust">
           Marcel Proust
          </a>
          (about the portal of the Virgin Golden of the Cathedral of Amiens)
         </cite>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <p>
       In 1885, Englishman
       <a href="/wiki/John_Ruskin" title="John Ruskin">
        John Ruskin
       </a>
       published the Bible of Amiens, which was translated into French, extensively annotated and prefaced, in 1904, by Marcel Proust. This book dedicated to
       <a href="/wiki/Amiens_Cathedral" title="Amiens Cathedral">
        Notre-Dame d'Amiens
       </a>
       was the opportunity for Proust to recall his admiration for the English author and the Cathedral of Amiens.
      </p>
      <table class="cquote pullquote" role="presentation" style="margin:auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: none; background-color: transparent; width: auto;">
       <tr>
        <td style="width: 20px; vertical-align: top; border: none; color: #B2B7F2; font-size: 40px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: bold; line-height: .6em; text-align: left; padding: 10px 10px;">
         “
        </td>
        <td style="vertical-align: top; border: none; padding: 4px 10px;">
         I would like to give the reader the desire and the means to spend a day at Amiens in a sort of Ruskinesque pilgrimage. It was not worth starting by asking him to go to Florence or Venice, when Ruskin wrote a whole book on Amiens.
        </td>
        <td style="width: 20px; vertical-align: bottom; border: none; color: #B2B7F2; font-size: 40px; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: bold; line-height: .6em; text-align: right; padding: 10px 10px;">
         ”
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td class="cquotecite" colspan="3" style="border: none; padding-right: 4%; font-size: smaller; text-align: right;">
         <cite>
          — Marcel Proust
         </cite>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <p>
       In the second half of the 19th century,
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Jules_Barni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Jules Barni (page does not exist)">
        Jules Barni
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jules_Barni" title="fr:Jules Barni">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       ,
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_d%C3%A9put%C3%A9s_of_the_Somme&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="List of députés of the Somme (page does not exist)">
        Member of Parliament for the Somme
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liste_des_d%C3%A9put%C3%A9s_de_la_Somme" title="fr:Liste des députés de la Somme">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , Associate Professor of philosophy and brilliant scholar translated Kant's work in French and thus enabled its dissemination in France.
      </p>
      <p>
       A native of Amiens,
       <a href="/wiki/Paul_Bourget" title="Paul Bourget">
        Paul Bourget
       </a>
       published
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Le_Disciple&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Le Disciple (page does not exist)">
        <i>
         Le Disciple
        </i>
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Le_Disciple" title="fr:Le Disciple">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       in 1889, novel today considered his major work. He was elected, 5 years later, to the Académie française.
      </p>
      <p>
       Born in Sainte-Anne district in 1885,
       <a href="/wiki/Roland_Dorgel%C3%A8s" title="Roland Dorgelès">
        Roland Dorgelès
       </a>
       published
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Les_Croix_de_bois&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Les Croix de bois (page does not exist)">
        <i>
         Les Croix de bois
        </i>
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Les_Croix_de_bois" title="fr:Les Croix de bois">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       in 1919. A masterpiece written from his notes taken at the
       <a href="/wiki/Western_Front_(World_War_I)" title="Western Front (World War I)">
        Front
       </a>
       , the novel won the
       <a href="/wiki/Prix_Femina" title="Prix Femina">
        Prix Femina
       </a>
       the same year. Though capable of obtaining the
       <a href="/wiki/Prix_Goncourt" title="Prix Goncourt">
        Prix Goncourt
       </a>
       , it was beaten by
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/%C3%80_l%27ombre_des_jeunes_filles_en_fleurs" title="À l'ombre des jeunes filles en fleurs">
        À l'ombre des jeunes filles en fleurs
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%80_l%27ombre_des_jeunes_filles_en_fleurs" title="fr:À l'ombre des jeunes filles en fleurs">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       of Marcel Proust, 6 votes against 4. A member of the
       <a href="/wiki/Acad%C3%A9mie_Goncourt" title="Académie Goncourt">
        Académie Goncourt
       </a>
       in 1929, he was elected president in 1954 until his death in 1973.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-173">
        <a href="#cite_note-173">
         [159]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       In 1926, the Amiens native
       <a href="/wiki/Henri_Deberly" title="Henri Deberly">
        Henri Deberly
       </a>
       , won the Prix Goncourt with
       <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Le_Supplice_de_Ph%C3%A8dre&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Le Supplice de Phèdre (page does not exist)">
        Le Supplice de Phèdre
       </a>
       <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
        (
        <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Le_Supplice_de_Ph%C3%A8dre" title="fr:Le Supplice de Phèdre">
         fr
        </a>
        )
       </span>
       , a novel inspired by his home city.
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Amiens_and_cinema">
        Amiens and cinema
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Amiens&amp;action=edit&amp;section=91" title="Edit section: Amiens and cinema">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <p>
       Several films or scenes from films were shot in Amiens and its surroundings.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-174">
        <a href="#cite_note-174">
         [160]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        1946:
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Jericho_(1946_film)" title="Jericho (1946 film)">
          Jéricho
         </a>
        </i>
        by
        <a href="/wiki/Henri_Calef" title="Henri Calef">
         Henri Calef
        </a>
        with
        <a href="/wiki/Nadine_Alari" title="Nadine Alari">
         Nadine Alari
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Pierre_Brasseur" title="Pierre Brasseur">
         Pierre Brasseur
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Jacques_Charon" title="Jacques Charon">
         Jacques Charon
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        1959:
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Head_Against_the_Wall" title="Head Against the Wall">
          Head Against the Wall
         </a>
        </i>
        , film of
        <a href="/wiki/Georges_Franju" title="Georges Franju">
         Georges Franju
        </a>
        , with
        <a href="/wiki/Pierre_Brasseur" title="Pierre Brasseur">
         Pierre Brasseur
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Jean-Pierre_Mocky" title="Jean-Pierre Mocky">
         Jean-Pierre Mocky
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        1970:
        <i>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Clowns_(film)" title="The Clowns (film)">
          The Clowns
         </a>
        </i>
        of
        <a href="/wiki/Federico_Fellini" title="Federico Fellini">
         Federico Fellini
        </a>
        around the
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Cirque_Jules-Verne&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Cirque Jules-Verne (page does not exist)">
         Cirque Jules-Verne
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cirque_Jules-Verne" title="fr:Cirque Jules-Verne">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
       </li>
       <li>
        1973:
        <i>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/La_Rose_de_Fer" title="La Rose de Fer">
          La Rose de Fer
         </a>
        </i>
        of
        <a href="/wiki/Jean_Rollin" title="Jean Rollin">
         Jean Rollin
        </a>
        with
        <a href="/wiki/Fran%C3%A7oise_Pascal" title="Françoise Pascal">
         Françoise Pascal
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/Hugues_Quester" title="Hugues Quester">
         Hugues Quester
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Nathalie_Perrey" title="Nathalie Perrey">
         Nathalie Perrey
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        1976:
        <i>
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=La_Saga_des_Fran%C3%A7ais:_La_Rumeur&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="La Saga des Français: La Rumeur (page does not exist)">
          La Saga des Français: La Rumeur
         </a>
        </i>
        , film of
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Michel_Pamart&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Michel Pamart (page does not exist)">
         Michel Pamart
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Marcel_Trillat" title="Marcel Trillat">
         Marcel Trillat
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        1980:
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/La_femme_enfant" title="La femme enfant">
          La femme enfant
         </a>
        </i>
        , film of
        <a href="/wiki/Rapha%C3%ABle_Billetdoux" title="Raphaële Billetdoux">
         Raphaële Billetdoux
        </a>
        , with
        <a href="/wiki/Klaus_Kinski" title="Klaus Kinski">
         Klaus Kinski
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        1989:
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Roselyne_et_les_lions" title="Roselyne et les lions">
          Roselyne et les lions
         </a>
        </i>
        of
        <a href="/wiki/Jean-Jacques_Beineix" title="Jean-Jacques Beineix">
         Jean-Jacques Beineix
        </a>
        , with
        <a href="/wiki/Isabelle_Pasco" title="Isabelle Pasco">
         Isabelle Pasco
        </a>
        filmed around Cirque Jules-Verne
       </li>
       <li>
        1991:
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Walking_a_Tightrope" title="Walking a Tightrope">
          Walking a Tightrope
         </a>
        </i>
        of
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Nico_Papatakis" title="Nico Papatakis">
         Nico Papatakis
        </a>
        , with
        <a href="/wiki/Michel_Piccoli" title="Michel Piccoli">
         Michel Piccoli
        </a>
        also filmed around Cirque Jules-Verne
       </li>
       <li>
        1994:
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Sister_My_Sister" title="Sister My Sister">
          Sister My Sister
         </a>
        </i>
        of
        <a href="/wiki/Nancy_Meckler" title="Nancy Meckler">
         Nancy Meckler
        </a>
        with
        <a href="/wiki/Julie_Walters" title="Julie Walters">
         Julie Walters
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Joely_Richardson" title="Joely Richardson">
         Joely Richardson
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        1997:
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Arlette_(film)" title="Arlette (film)">
          Arlette
         </a>
        </i>
        of
        <a href="/wiki/Claude_Zidi" title="Claude Zidi">
         Claude Zidi
        </a>
        , with
        <a href="/wiki/Josiane_Balasko" title="Josiane Balasko">
         Josiane Balasko
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Christopher_Lambert" title="Christopher Lambert">
         Christopher Lambert
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        1999:
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Je_suis_n%C3%A9_d%27une_cigogne" title="Je suis né d'une cigogne">
          Je suis né d'une cigogne
         </a>
        </i>
        , film of
        <a href="/wiki/Tony_Gatlif" title="Tony Gatlif">
         Tony Gatlif
        </a>
        , with
        <a href="/wiki/Romain_Duris" title="Romain Duris">
         Romain Duris
        </a>
       </li>
       <li>
        2000:
        <i>
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Elle_et_lui_au_14e_%C3%A9tage&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Elle et lui au 14e étage (page does not exist)">
          Elle et lui au 14e étage
         </a>
        </i>
        of
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Sophie_Blondy&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Sophie Blondy (page does not exist)">
         Sophie Blondy
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sophie_Blondy" title="fr:Sophie Blondy">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        , with
        <a href="/wiki/Guillaume_Depardieu" title="Guillaume Depardieu">
         Guillaume Depardieu
        </a>
        and
        <a href="/wiki/Beno%C3%AEt_Magimel" title="Benoît Magimel">
         Benoît Magimel
        </a>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-175">
         <a href="#cite_note-175">
          [161]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-St_Leu_176-0">

          [162]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        2000:
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Confort_moderne_(film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Confort moderne (film) (page does not exist)">
         <i>
          Confort moderne
         </i>
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">

        <i>

        </i>

        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">

         )
        </span>
       </li>
       <li>
        2008:
        <i>
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Paul_Rondin_est...Paul_Rondin&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Paul Rondin est...Paul Rondin (page does not exist)">

         </a>
        </i>
        , short film of
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Fr%C3%A9d%C3%A9ric_Vin&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Frédéric Vin (page does not exist)">
         Frédéric Vin
        </a>
        , with
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Fran%C3%A7ois_Berland&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="François Berland (page does not exist)">
         François Berland
        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">
         (
         <a class="extiw" href="https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fran%C3%A7ois_Berland" title="fr:François Berland">
          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
       </li>
       <li>
        2008:
        <i>
         <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Blanche_(film,_2008)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Blanche (film, 2008) (page does not exist)">
          Blanche
         </a>
        </i>
        , short film of
        <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Eric_Griffon_du_Bellay&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Eric Griffon du Bellay (page does not exist)">

        </a>
        , with

        <i>
         Tour Bleue
        </i>
        (before its destruction), in the Étouvie quarter.

        </a>
        <span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">

          fr
         </a>
         )
        </span>
        , with
        <a href="/wiki/Hafsia_Herzi" title="Hafsia Herzi">

        </a>
